Tianwei Liu, CEO & Co-Founder of StraitsX, had this to say about our journey in unlocking blockchain-enabled payments when he recently sat down for the latest instalment of the 'On Call withInsignia Ventures Partners' podcast series: 

"It’s almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD transacted on-chain… It’s beyond our [expectations] initially how this has come along. A lot of us here are big believers.. and technology is at the heart of what we do. We’re trying to solve problems. And we see that blockchain solutions do have merit to address things that traditional centralised systems [otherwise] cannot do. And that’s why we have been very focused and interested in the [real-world] application of stablecoins."

Listen to Part 1 of the podcast below, and keep a look out for Part 2 soon! 33,500 followers 🎙️ New podcast episode 🚀 4 impacts ofStraitsXin-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of fiat-backed stablecoins XSGD and XUSD

This week’s episode has returning guestTianwei Liu, Deputy CEO of Southeast Asia#fintechgroupFazz, the company behind digital asset infrastructure providerStraitsX. 

In 2023’sSingapore FinTech Festival, StraitsX received in-principle approval by the MAS for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD, opening up opportunities we cover in this first half of our call with the seasoned fintech#entrepreneur. 

1️⃣ For Fazz: building on five years of pioneering blockchain transactions to unlock more inter-currency corridors

🎙️ “It's almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD has been transacted on-chain...it gives us the confidence that this is going to be a regulated industry...and beyond the Singapore dollars...we are now able to issue G10 currency stablecoins out of Singapore with this new license regime and XUSD, which is what we're gonna be focusing our effort on in the coming years.”

2️⃣ For Singapore and ASEAN: More mainstream adoption with increased credibility and trust from regulators and institutions

🎙️ “It brings about the credibility that using this kind of medium to facilitate innovation in payment is the way that regulators around the world should be looking at this...It allows service providers like us and other players to be able to confidently say that what we are doing is regulated and we are doing this according to the standards needed both on the AML control side, as well on custody and the way that we safeguard the user's funds.”

3️⃣ For merchants and end-consumers: The same transactions, but faster, cheaper, and more interoperable thanks to blockchain technology (we cover the case of StraitsX collaborating with Grabpay and Alipay)

🎙️ “We can make this purpose-bound money the most purposeful and compliant by design...So the ML and compliance risk can be ring-fenced and properly controlled. Settlement will be instantaneous. Then the FX ability of the blockchain...can happen at a microtransaction level.”

4️⃣ For payments industry: Moving forward momentum of innovation (that comes in stages)

🎙️ “First, increase the acceptance and make sure that it's as seamless as possible without drop off rate. Then you go into costs. Can I make sure my cost is as low as possible, especially for cross border...Then the innovation, which is free game for a lot of guys to come in.”

👉 See the rest of the insights and the full podcast on Insignia Business Review:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9t👀 Or watch it on
Spotify:https://lnkd.in/gVbMjfSCApple Podcasts:https://lnkd.in/gyiryNiXYouTube:youtu.be/y-kEDB-ge_A📸 Photo from StraitsX

Today we share a timely story on the value of localizing frontier technologies like digital assets on a regulatory and compliance level

This isTianwei Liu, Group Deputy CEO ofFazz. (Photo taken from when we took our limited partners to visit the Singapore Fazz office for our Annual Summit)

Tianwei is an engineer who returned to Singapore from Silicon Valley, and in 2015 started a payments infrastructure company thanks in part to some cross-border Christmas gift experiences (he shares more in our podcast). Along the way, an initiative came about internally to develop Singapore’s first regulated stablecoin throughStraitsX. 

Fast forward to 2023, their work in maturing this stablecoin marked a new milestone in last week’sSingapore FinTech Festival.

In a speech (see link in the comments), theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)’s Managing Director Ravi Menon also announced that “MAS has granted in-principle approval under the Payment Services Act to three entities who will issue stable coins that substantively comply with MAS’ upcoming stablecoin regulatory framework…Once the legislative amendments take effect, these stable coins will be regarded as “MAS-regulated stablecoins”. These includeStraitsXSGD issuance that will house the XSGD pegged stablecoin already on the market, and StraitsX USD Issuance. 

This is a step forward in developing a truly sustainable digital currency. And through Project Orchid, well-regulated stable coins are already being trialled for use cases like purpose-bound money. For example, StraitsX enables XSGD-backed purpose-bound money to facilitate escrow arrangements in e-commerce transactions, ensuring that funds are released to merchants only when the customer receives the purchased items. It was also tested in the Festival, in partnership with Amazon and Grab.

This development comes full circle to what Tianwei shared on our podcast a year ago: 
“You’re going to have a world that is going to be nominated in US dollars, everything is US dollars-based, but day-to-day wise, do we ever see a US dollar and we will use it as the ultimate payment [method]? 

I don’t think that will ever happen. So we need to figure out how to make sure that there is a thriving decentralized finance ecosystem in the Asia Pacific. Be it Singaporean dollars, Indonesia rupiah, Philippine pesos or in Vietnamese dong, it has to be built out by the locals, and that will require us to be the pioneers. And actually working very closely with regulators to build out that ecosystem for ourselves.” 

Localization for startups is no longer just a matter of developing products for a specific market, but ensuring that the business is operationally compliant with local regulations. This presents an even greater competitive advantage for startups able to develop their compliance muscle. 

Kudos to Tianwei and the StraitsX team for this milestone!#digitalassets#sff2023#straitsx#fazz#IVPAnnualSummit2023

profile_bio:
StraitsX is the pioneering payments infrastructure for the digital assets space in Southeast Asia. It is a Major Payment Institution licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore. 

StraitsX offers personal and business accounts to transfer and hold funds as well as to connect accounts to digital asset platforms. Business accounts can also access B2B API-enabled payments rails for digital asset platforms. 

StraitsX issues the Singapore Dollar-backed stablecoin, XSGD & Indonesian Rupiah-backed stablecoin.

StraitsX is a brand under Fazz, backed and supported by prominent investors including Tiger Global, Insignia Venture Partners, B Capital, BRI Ventures.

For more information, please visit straitsx.com.

🎙ICYMI: Our CEO and Co-Founder,Tianwei Liusat down withInsignia Ventures Partnersfor a two-part podcast; sharing insights and personal learnings from developing regulatory and compliance maturity across seven years of pioneering#fintechinfrastructure solutions out of Singapore and more than ten years of#entrepreneurship.

🎧 Catch up on both parts today:
Part 1:https://lnkd.in/gp8Af8GMPart 2:https://lnkd.in/gpSCRh5f 33,537 followers 🎙️ Part 2 of this week's#podcastwithFazzDeputy CEOTianwei Liu🚀 5#Regulationand#compliancelearnings from 10+ years pioneering#fintechsolutions out of#Singapore🇸🇬

InSingapore FinTech Festival2023, Fazz's digital asset infrastructure business StraitsX received in-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD stablecoins, opening up opportunities we covered in part 1:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9tPart 2 goes into learnings developing regulatory and compliance maturity from 7+ years pioneering fintech infrastructure solutions out of Singapore 

1️⃣ Continuous dialogue is key. 

🎙️ “...for compliance and fintech, talking to regulators, having an open dialogue, showing consistency and who's the person behind the company and what are you trying to achieve here...builds trust and credibility.”

2️⃣ A culture of customer-centric compliance is even more important to set the pace of product development, especially when developers are layers away from end-consumers. 

🎙️ “...“move fast and break things” does not apply here. In payments and fintech, you can't break things...You actually have to set the culture to do things right the first time and consider the impact on the customers and on people…”

3️⃣ Participate in regulatory sandboxes and make the most of regulatory openness to experimentation.

🎙️ “[They] allow you to basically do the smallest field experiments, to demonstrate certain things before getting to your bigger customers…”

4️⃣ Regulation opens doors to previously inaccessible market segments (e.g., FIs and banks) but the product makes the first step. 

🎙️ “Getting these licenses and compliance helps to give you a stamp of approval. It is not enough, but it's definitely more helpful to at least help education move along. It also means that institutions are able then to adopt this blockchain technology...you can then serve a wider customer that traditionally would either be fearful or unable to reach.”

5️⃣ Time and place matter when it comes to regulation. There are also regulatory blue oceans as well and this factors into the growth potential of the business. 

“Singapore is in a perfect position to do it, because of the regulation regime where you probably would think about China and other jurisdictions being geopolitically sensitive as well...potentially, this means for the whole entire region there will be a lot more adoption given that now Singapore has set the bar down.”

👉 See the rest of the insights:https://lnkd.in/gKcWyCYV👀 Or watch it on
Spotify:https://lnkd.in/g6D3_Z5vApple Podcasts:https://lnkd.in/gg36bWHNYouTube:https://lnkd.in/gKZ2aXRT

Tianwei Liu, CEO & Co-Founder of StraitsX, had this to say about our journey in unlocking blockchain-enabled payments when he recently sat down for the latest instalment of the 'On Call withInsignia Ventures Partners' podcast series: 

"It’s almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD transacted on-chain… It’s beyond our [expectations] initially how this has come along. A lot of us here are big believers.. and technology is at the heart of what we do. We’re trying to solve problems. And we see that blockchain solutions do have merit to address things that traditional centralised systems [otherwise] cannot do. And that’s why we have been very focused and interested in the [real-world] application of stablecoins."

Listen to Part 1 of the podcast below, and keep a look out for Part 2 soon! 33,537 followers 🎙️ New podcast episode 🚀 4 impacts ofStraitsXin-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of fiat-backed stablecoins XSGD and XUSD

This week’s episode has returning guestTianwei Liu, Deputy CEO of Southeast Asia#fintechgroupFazz, the company behind digital asset infrastructure providerStraitsX. 

In 2023’sSingapore FinTech Festival, StraitsX received in-principle approval by the MAS for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD, opening up opportunities we cover in this first half of our call with the seasoned fintech#entrepreneur. 

1️⃣ For Fazz: building on five years of pioneering blockchain transactions to unlock more inter-currency corridors

🎙️ “It's almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD has been transacted on-chain...it gives us the confidence that this is going to be a regulated industry...and beyond the Singapore dollars...we are now able to issue G10 currency stablecoins out of Singapore with this new license regime and XUSD, which is what we're gonna be focusing our effort on in the coming years.”

2️⃣ For Singapore and ASEAN: More mainstream adoption with increased credibility and trust from regulators and institutions

🎙️ “It brings about the credibility that using this kind of medium to facilitate innovation in payment is the way that regulators around the world should be looking at this...It allows service providers like us and other players to be able to confidently say that what we are doing is regulated and we are doing this according to the standards needed both on the AML control side, as well on custody and the way that we safeguard the user's funds.”

3️⃣ For merchants and end-consumers: The same transactions, but faster, cheaper, and more interoperable thanks to blockchain technology (we cover the case of StraitsX collaborating with Grabpay and Alipay)

🎙️ “We can make this purpose-bound money the most purposeful and compliant by design...So the ML and compliance risk can be ring-fenced and properly controlled. Settlement will be instantaneous. Then the FX ability of the blockchain...can happen at a microtransaction level.”

4️⃣ For payments industry: Moving forward momentum of innovation (that comes in stages)

🎙️ “First, increase the acceptance and make sure that it's as seamless as possible without drop off rate. Then you go into costs. Can I make sure my cost is as low as possible, especially for cross border...Then the innovation, which is free game for a lot of guys to come in.”

👉 See the rest of the insights and the full podcast on Insignia Business Review:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9t👀 Or watch it on
Spotify:https://lnkd.in/gVbMjfSCApple Podcasts:https://lnkd.in/gyiryNiXYouTube:youtu.be/y-kEDB-ge_A📸 Photo from StraitsX

Today we share a timely story on the value of localizing frontier technologies like digital assets on a regulatory and compliance level

This isTianwei Liu, Group Deputy CEO ofFazz. (Photo taken from when we took our limited partners to visit the Singapore Fazz office for our Annual Summit)

Tianwei is an engineer who returned to Singapore from Silicon Valley, and in 2015 started a payments infrastructure company thanks in part to some cross-border Christmas gift experiences (he shares more in our podcast). Along the way, an initiative came about internally to develop Singapore’s first regulated stablecoin throughStraitsX. 

Fast forward to 2023, their work in maturing this stablecoin marked a new milestone in last week’sSingapore FinTech Festival.

In a speech (see link in the comments), theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)’s Managing Director Ravi Menon also announced that “MAS has granted in-principle approval under the Payment Services Act to three entities who will issue stable coins that substantively comply with MAS’ upcoming stablecoin regulatory framework…Once the legislative amendments take effect, these stable coins will be regarded as “MAS-regulated stablecoins”. These includeStraitsXSGD issuance that will house the XSGD pegged stablecoin already on the market, and StraitsX USD Issuance. 

This is a step forward in developing a truly sustainable digital currency. And through Project Orchid, well-regulated stable coins are already being trialled for use cases like purpose-bound money. For example, StraitsX enables XSGD-backed purpose-bound money to facilitate escrow arrangements in e-commerce transactions, ensuring that funds are released to merchants only when the customer receives the purchased items. It was also tested in the Festival, in partnership with Amazon and Grab.

This development comes full circle to what Tianwei shared on our podcast a year ago: 
“You’re going to have a world that is going to be nominated in US dollars, everything is US dollars-based, but day-to-day wise, do we ever see a US dollar and we will use it as the ultimate payment [method]? 

I don’t think that will ever happen. So we need to figure out how to make sure that there is a thriving decentralized finance ecosystem in the Asia Pacific. Be it Singaporean dollars, Indonesia rupiah, Philippine pesos or in Vietnamese dong, it has to be built out by the locals, and that will require us to be the pioneers. And actually working very closely with regulators to build out that ecosystem for ourselves.” 

Localization for startups is no longer just a matter of developing products for a specific market, but ensuring that the business is operationally compliant with local regulations. This presents an even greater competitive advantage for startups able to develop their compliance muscle. 

Kudos to Tianwei and the StraitsX team for this milestone!#digitalassets#sff2023#straitsx#fazz#IVPAnnualSummit2023

profile_bio:
StraitsX is the pioneering payments infrastructure for the digital assets space in Southeast Asia. It is a Major Payment Institution licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore. 

StraitsX offers personal and business accounts to transfer and hold funds as well as to connect accounts to digital asset platforms. Business accounts can also access B2B API-enabled payments rails for digital asset platforms. 

StraitsX issues the Singapore Dollar-backed stablecoin, XSGD & Indonesian Rupiah-backed stablecoin.

StraitsX is a brand under Fazz, backed and supported by prominent investors including Tiger Global, Insignia Venture Partners, B Capital, BRI Ventures.

For more information, please visit straitsx.com.

🌟 Exciting insights from this morning's roundtable discussion on "Digital Money in Action" atJapan FinTech Festival! 💼💡

Together with other esteemed industry leaders, our CEO and Co-founder,Tianwei Liuexplored how#stablecoinsand#blockchaintechnology are revolutionising cross-border payments, enhancing efficiency, reducing costs, with concepts of programmability and interoperability at the core of a more robust payments and financial system.

Some key discussion points include:
1. Adopting a "compliance by design" model in leveraging the programmability of blockchain to ensure regulatory adherence 🛡️💻

2. Emphasizing the need for inclusive and intuitive product design - and allowing users to enjoy seamless payment experiences without having to grasp the intricacies of blockchain technology 📲🔗

3. The significance of interoperability to minimise "walled gardens" and promote seamless connectivity across platforms 🌐🤝

We look forward to exciting times ahead as we continue to drive innovation and accessibility in the realm of digital money. Find out more atStraitsX.com#jff2024#digitalmoney#crossborderpayments

🎙ICYMI: Our CEO and Co-Founder,Tianwei Liusat down withInsignia Ventures Partnersfor a two-part podcast; sharing insights and personal learnings from developing regulatory and compliance maturity across seven years of pioneering#fintechinfrastructure solutions out of Singapore and more than ten years of#entrepreneurship.

🎧 Catch up on both parts today:
Part 1:https://lnkd.in/gp8Af8GMPart 2:https://lnkd.in/gpSCRh5f 33,685 followers 🎙️ Part 2 of this week's#podcastwithFazzDeputy CEOTianwei Liu🚀 5#Regulationand#compliancelearnings from 10+ years pioneering#fintechsolutions out of#Singapore🇸🇬

InSingapore FinTech Festival2023, Fazz's digital asset infrastructure business StraitsX received in-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD stablecoins, opening up opportunities we covered in part 1:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9tPart 2 goes into learnings developing regulatory and compliance maturity from 7+ years pioneering fintech infrastructure solutions out of Singapore 

1️⃣ Continuous dialogue is key. 

🎙️ “...for compliance and fintech, talking to regulators, having an open dialogue, showing consistency and who's the person behind the company and what are you trying to achieve here...builds trust and credibility.”

2️⃣ A culture of customer-centric compliance is even more important to set the pace of product development, especially when developers are layers away from end-consumers. 

🎙️ “...“move fast and break things” does not apply here. In payments and fintech, you can't break things...You actually have to set the culture to do things right the first time and consider the impact on the customers and on people…”

3️⃣ Participate in regulatory sandboxes and make the most of regulatory openness to experimentation.

🎙️ “[They] allow you to basically do the smallest field experiments, to demonstrate certain things before getting to your bigger customers…”

4️⃣ Regulation opens doors to previously inaccessible market segments (e.g., FIs and banks) but the product makes the first step. 

🎙️ “Getting these licenses and compliance helps to give you a stamp of approval. It is not enough, but it's definitely more helpful to at least help education move along. It also means that institutions are able then to adopt this blockchain technology...you can then serve a wider customer that traditionally would either be fearful or unable to reach.”

5️⃣ Time and place matter when it comes to regulation. There are also regulatory blue oceans as well and this factors into the growth potential of the business. 

“Singapore is in a perfect position to do it, because of the regulation regime where you probably would think about China and other jurisdictions being geopolitically sensitive as well...potentially, this means for the whole entire region there will be a lot more adoption given that now Singapore has set the bar down.”

Tianwei Liu, CEO & Co-Founder of StraitsX, had this to say about our journey in unlocking blockchain-enabled payments when he recently sat down for the latest instalment of the 'On Call withInsignia Ventures Partners' podcast series: 

"It’s almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD transacted on-chain… It’s beyond our [expectations] initially how this has come along. A lot of us here are big believers.. and technology is at the heart of what we do. We’re trying to solve problems. And we see that blockchain solutions do have merit to address things that traditional centralised systems [otherwise] cannot do. And that’s why we have been very focused and interested in the [real-world] application of stablecoins."

Listen to Part 1 of the podcast below, and keep a look out for Part 2 soon! 33,685 followers 🎙️ New podcast episode 🚀 4 impacts ofStraitsXin-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of fiat-backed stablecoins XSGD and XUSD

This week’s episode has returning guestTianwei Liu, Deputy CEO of Southeast Asia#fintechgroupFazz, the company behind digital asset infrastructure providerStraitsX. 

In 2023’sSingapore FinTech Festival, StraitsX received in-principle approval by the MAS for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD, opening up opportunities we cover in this first half of our call with the seasoned fintech#entrepreneur. 

1️⃣ For Fazz: building on five years of pioneering blockchain transactions to unlock more inter-currency corridors

🎙️ “It's almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD has been transacted on-chain...it gives us the confidence that this is going to be a regulated industry...and beyond the Singapore dollars...we are now able to issue G10 currency stablecoins out of Singapore with this new license regime and XUSD, which is what we're gonna be focusing our effort on in the coming years.”

2️⃣ For Singapore and ASEAN: More mainstream adoption with increased credibility and trust from regulators and institutions

🎙️ “It brings about the credibility that using this kind of medium to facilitate innovation in payment is the way that regulators around the world should be looking at this...It allows service providers like us and other players to be able to confidently say that what we are doing is regulated and we are doing this according to the standards needed both on the AML control side, as well on custody and the way that we safeguard the user's funds.”

3️⃣ For merchants and end-consumers: The same transactions, but faster, cheaper, and more interoperable thanks to blockchain technology (we cover the case of StraitsX collaborating with Grabpay and Alipay)

🎙️ “We can make this purpose-bound money the most purposeful and compliant by design...So the ML and compliance risk can be ring-fenced and properly controlled. Settlement will be instantaneous. Then the FX ability of the blockchain...can happen at a microtransaction level.”

4️⃣ For payments industry: Moving forward momentum of innovation (that comes in stages)

🎙️ “First, increase the acceptance and make sure that it's as seamless as possible without drop off rate. Then you go into costs. Can I make sure my cost is as low as possible, especially for cross border...Then the innovation, which is free game for a lot of guys to come in.”

Today we share a timely story on the value of localizing frontier technologies like digital assets on a regulatory and compliance level

This isTianwei Liu, Group Deputy CEO ofFazz. (Photo taken from when we took our limited partners to visit the Singapore Fazz office for our Annual Summit)

Tianwei is an engineer who returned to Singapore from Silicon Valley, and in 2015 started a payments infrastructure company thanks in part to some cross-border Christmas gift experiences (he shares more in our podcast). Along the way, an initiative came about internally to develop Singapore’s first regulated stablecoin throughStraitsX. 

Fast forward to 2023, their work in maturing this stablecoin marked a new milestone in last week’sSingapore FinTech Festival.

In a speech (see link in the comments), theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)’s Managing Director Ravi Menon also announced that “MAS has granted in-principle approval under the Payment Services Act to three entities who will issue stable coins that substantively comply with MAS’ upcoming stablecoin regulatory framework…Once the legislative amendments take effect, these stable coins will be regarded as “MAS-regulated stablecoins”. These includeStraitsXSGD issuance that will house the XSGD pegged stablecoin already on the market, and StraitsX USD Issuance. 

This is a step forward in developing a truly sustainable digital currency. And through Project Orchid, well-regulated stable coins are already being trialled for use cases like purpose-bound money. For example, StraitsX enables XSGD-backed purpose-bound money to facilitate escrow arrangements in e-commerce transactions, ensuring that funds are released to merchants only when the customer receives the purchased items. It was also tested in the Festival, in partnership with Amazon and Grab.

This development comes full circle to what Tianwei shared on our podcast a year ago: 
“You’re going to have a world that is going to be nominated in US dollars, everything is US dollars-based, but day-to-day wise, do we ever see a US dollar and we will use it as the ultimate payment [method]? 

I don’t think that will ever happen. So we need to figure out how to make sure that there is a thriving decentralized finance ecosystem in the Asia Pacific. Be it Singaporean dollars, Indonesia rupiah, Philippine pesos or in Vietnamese dong, it has to be built out by the locals, and that will require us to be the pioneers. And actually working very closely with regulators to build out that ecosystem for ourselves.” 

Localization for startups is no longer just a matter of developing products for a specific market, but ensuring that the business is operationally compliant with local regulations. This presents an even greater competitive advantage for startups able to develop their compliance muscle. 

Kudos to Tianwei and the StraitsX team for this milestone!#digitalassets#sff2023#straitsx#fazz#IVPAnnualSummit2023

profile_bio:
StraitsX is the pioneering payments infrastructure for the digital assets space in Southeast Asia. It is a Major Payment Institution licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore. 

StraitsX offers personal and business accounts to transfer and hold funds as well as to connect accounts to digital asset platforms. Business accounts can also access B2B API-enabled payments rails for digital asset platforms. 

StraitsX issues the Singapore Dollar-backed stablecoin, XSGD & Indonesian Rupiah-backed stablecoin.

StraitsX is a brand under Fazz, backed and supported by prominent investors including Tiger Global, Insignia Venture Partners, B Capital, BRI Ventures.

For more information, please visit straitsx.com.

🎙ICYMI: Our CEO and Co-Founder,Tianwei Liusat down withInsignia Ventures Partnersfor a two-part podcast; sharing insights and personal learnings from developing regulatory and compliance maturity across seven years of pioneering#fintechinfrastructure solutions out of Singapore and more than ten years of#entrepreneurship.

🎧 Catch up on both parts today:
Part 1:https://lnkd.in/gp8Af8GMPart 2:https://lnkd.in/gpSCRh5f 33,728 followers 🎙️ Part 2 of this week's#podcastwithFazzDeputy CEOTianwei Liu🚀 5#Regulationand#compliancelearnings from 10+ years pioneering#fintechsolutions out of#Singapore🇸🇬

InSingapore FinTech Festival2023, Fazz's digital asset infrastructure business StraitsX received in-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD stablecoins, opening up opportunities we covered in part 1:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9tPart 2 goes into learnings developing regulatory and compliance maturity from 7+ years pioneering fintech infrastructure solutions out of Singapore 

1️⃣ Continuous dialogue is key. 

🎙️ “...for compliance and fintech, talking to regulators, having an open dialogue, showing consistency and who's the person behind the company and what are you trying to achieve here...builds trust and credibility.”

2️⃣ A culture of customer-centric compliance is even more important to set the pace of product development, especially when developers are layers away from end-consumers. 

🎙️ “...“move fast and break things” does not apply here. In payments and fintech, you can't break things...You actually have to set the culture to do things right the first time and consider the impact on the customers and on people…”

3️⃣ Participate in regulatory sandboxes and make the most of regulatory openness to experimentation.

🎙️ “[They] allow you to basically do the smallest field experiments, to demonstrate certain things before getting to your bigger customers…”

4️⃣ Regulation opens doors to previously inaccessible market segments (e.g., FIs and banks) but the product makes the first step. 

🎙️ “Getting these licenses and compliance helps to give you a stamp of approval. It is not enough, but it's definitely more helpful to at least help education move along. It also means that institutions are able then to adopt this blockchain technology...you can then serve a wider customer that traditionally would either be fearful or unable to reach.”

5️⃣ Time and place matter when it comes to regulation. There are also regulatory blue oceans as well and this factors into the growth potential of the business. 

“Singapore is in a perfect position to do it, because of the regulation regime where you probably would think about China and other jurisdictions being geopolitically sensitive as well...potentially, this means for the whole entire region there will be a lot more adoption given that now Singapore has set the bar down.”

👉 See the rest of the insights:https://lnkd.in/gKcWyCYV👀 Or watch it on
Spotify:https://lnkd.in/g6D3_Z5vApple Podcasts:https://lnkd.in/gg36bWHNYouTube:https://lnkd.in/gKZ2aXRT

Tianwei Liu, CEO & Co-Founder of StraitsX, had this to say about our journey in unlocking blockchain-enabled payments when he recently sat down for the latest instalment of the 'On Call withInsignia Ventures Partners' podcast series: 

"It’s almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD transacted on-chain… It’s beyond our [expectations] initially how this has come along. A lot of us here are big believers.. and technology is at the heart of what we do. We’re trying to solve problems. And we see that blockchain solutions do have merit to address things that traditional centralised systems [otherwise] cannot do. And that’s why we have been very focused and interested in the [real-world] application of stablecoins."

Listen to Part 1 of the podcast below, and keep a look out for Part 2 soon! 33,728 followers 🎙️ New podcast episode 🚀 4 impacts ofStraitsXin-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of fiat-backed stablecoins XSGD and XUSD

This week’s episode has returning guestTianwei Liu, Deputy CEO of Southeast Asia#fintechgroupFazz, the company behind digital asset infrastructure providerStraitsX. 

In 2023’sSingapore FinTech Festival, StraitsX received in-principle approval by the MAS for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD, opening up opportunities we cover in this first half of our call with the seasoned fintech#entrepreneur. 

1️⃣ For Fazz: building on five years of pioneering blockchain transactions to unlock more inter-currency corridors

🎙️ “It's almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD has been transacted on-chain...it gives us the confidence that this is going to be a regulated industry...and beyond the Singapore dollars...we are now able to issue G10 currency stablecoins out of Singapore with this new license regime and XUSD, which is what we're gonna be focusing our effort on in the coming years.”

2️⃣ For Singapore and ASEAN: More mainstream adoption with increased credibility and trust from regulators and institutions

🎙️ “It brings about the credibility that using this kind of medium to facilitate innovation in payment is the way that regulators around the world should be looking at this...It allows service providers like us and other players to be able to confidently say that what we are doing is regulated and we are doing this according to the standards needed both on the AML control side, as well on custody and the way that we safeguard the user's funds.”

3️⃣ For merchants and end-consumers: The same transactions, but faster, cheaper, and more interoperable thanks to blockchain technology (we cover the case of StraitsX collaborating with Grabpay and Alipay)

🎙️ “We can make this purpose-bound money the most purposeful and compliant by design...So the ML and compliance risk can be ring-fenced and properly controlled. Settlement will be instantaneous. Then the FX ability of the blockchain...can happen at a microtransaction level.”

4️⃣ For payments industry: Moving forward momentum of innovation (that comes in stages)

🎙️ “First, increase the acceptance and make sure that it's as seamless as possible without drop off rate. Then you go into costs. Can I make sure my cost is as low as possible, especially for cross border...Then the innovation, which is free game for a lot of guys to come in.”

👉 See the rest of the insights and the full podcast on Insignia Business Review:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9t👀 Or watch it on
Spotify:https://lnkd.in/gVbMjfSCApple Podcasts:https://lnkd.in/gyiryNiXYouTube:youtu.be/y-kEDB-ge_A📸 Photo from StraitsX

Today we share a timely story on the value of localizing frontier technologies like digital assets on a regulatory and compliance level

This isTianwei Liu, Group Deputy CEO ofFazz. (Photo taken from when we took our limited partners to visit the Singapore Fazz office for our Annual Summit)

Tianwei is an engineer who returned to Singapore from Silicon Valley, and in 2015 started a payments infrastructure company thanks in part to some cross-border Christmas gift experiences (he shares more in our podcast). Along the way, an initiative came about internally to develop Singapore’s first regulated stablecoin throughStraitsX. 

Fast forward to 2023, their work in maturing this stablecoin marked a new milestone in last week’sSingapore FinTech Festival.

In a speech (see link in the comments), theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)’s Managing Director Ravi Menon also announced that “MAS has granted in-principle approval under the Payment Services Act to three entities who will issue stable coins that substantively comply with MAS’ upcoming stablecoin regulatory framework…Once the legislative amendments take effect, these stable coins will be regarded as “MAS-regulated stablecoins”. These includeStraitsXSGD issuance that will house the XSGD pegged stablecoin already on the market, and StraitsX USD Issuance. 

This is a step forward in developing a truly sustainable digital currency. And through Project Orchid, well-regulated stable coins are already being trialled for use cases like purpose-bound money. For example, StraitsX enables XSGD-backed purpose-bound money to facilitate escrow arrangements in e-commerce transactions, ensuring that funds are released to merchants only when the customer receives the purchased items. It was also tested in the Festival, in partnership with Amazon and Grab.

This development comes full circle to what Tianwei shared on our podcast a year ago: 
“You’re going to have a world that is going to be nominated in US dollars, everything is US dollars-based, but day-to-day wise, do we ever see a US dollar and we will use it as the ultimate payment [method]? 

I don’t think that will ever happen. So we need to figure out how to make sure that there is a thriving decentralized finance ecosystem in the Asia Pacific. Be it Singaporean dollars, Indonesia rupiah, Philippine pesos or in Vietnamese dong, it has to be built out by the locals, and that will require us to be the pioneers. And actually working very closely with regulators to build out that ecosystem for ourselves.” 

Localization for startups is no longer just a matter of developing products for a specific market, but ensuring that the business is operationally compliant with local regulations. This presents an even greater competitive advantage for startups able to develop their compliance muscle. 

Kudos to Tianwei and the StraitsX team for this milestone!#digitalassets#sff2023#straitsx#fazz#IVPAnnualSummit2023

profile_bio:
StraitsX is the pioneering payments infrastructure for the digital assets space in Southeast Asia. It is a Major Payment Institution licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore. 

StraitsX offers personal and business accounts to transfer and hold funds as well as to connect accounts to digital asset platforms. Business accounts can also access B2B API-enabled payments rails for digital asset platforms. 

StraitsX issues the Singapore Dollar-backed stablecoin, XSGD & Indonesian Rupiah-backed stablecoin.

StraitsX is a brand under Fazz, backed and supported by prominent investors including Tiger Global, Insignia Venture Partners, B Capital, BRI Ventures.

For more information, please visit straitsx.com.

🎙ICYMI: Our CEO and Co-Founder,Tianwei Liusat down withInsignia Ventures Partnersfor a two-part podcast; sharing insights and personal learnings from developing regulatory and compliance maturity across seven years of pioneering#fintechinfrastructure solutions out of Singapore and more than ten years of#entrepreneurship.

🎧 Catch up on both parts today:
Part 1:https://lnkd.in/gp8Af8GMPart 2:https://lnkd.in/gpSCRh5f 33,757 followers 🎙️ Part 2 of this week's#podcastwithFazzDeputy CEOTianwei Liu🚀 5#Regulationand#compliancelearnings from 10+ years pioneering#fintechsolutions out of#Singapore🇸🇬

InSingapore FinTech Festival2023, Fazz's digital asset infrastructure business StraitsX received in-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD stablecoins, opening up opportunities we covered in part 1:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9tPart 2 goes into learnings developing regulatory and compliance maturity from 7+ years pioneering fintech infrastructure solutions out of Singapore 

1️⃣ Continuous dialogue is key. 

🎙️ “...for compliance and fintech, talking to regulators, having an open dialogue, showing consistency and who's the person behind the company and what are you trying to achieve here...builds trust and credibility.”

2️⃣ A culture of customer-centric compliance is even more important to set the pace of product development, especially when developers are layers away from end-consumers. 

🎙️ “...“move fast and break things” does not apply here. In payments and fintech, you can't break things...You actually have to set the culture to do things right the first time and consider the impact on the customers and on people…”

3️⃣ Participate in regulatory sandboxes and make the most of regulatory openness to experimentation.

🎙️ “[They] allow you to basically do the smallest field experiments, to demonstrate certain things before getting to your bigger customers…”

4️⃣ Regulation opens doors to previously inaccessible market segments (e.g., FIs and banks) but the product makes the first step. 

🎙️ “Getting these licenses and compliance helps to give you a stamp of approval. It is not enough, but it's definitely more helpful to at least help education move along. It also means that institutions are able then to adopt this blockchain technology...you can then serve a wider customer that traditionally would either be fearful or unable to reach.”

5️⃣ Time and place matter when it comes to regulation. There are also regulatory blue oceans as well and this factors into the growth potential of the business. 

“Singapore is in a perfect position to do it, because of the regulation regime where you probably would think about China and other jurisdictions being geopolitically sensitive as well...potentially, this means for the whole entire region there will be a lot more adoption given that now Singapore has set the bar down.”

👉 See the rest of the insights:https://lnkd.in/gKcWyCYV👀 Or watch it on
Spotify:https://lnkd.in/g6D3_Z5vApple Podcasts:https://lnkd.in/gg36bWHNYouTube:https://lnkd.in/gKZ2aXRT

Tianwei Liu, CEO & Co-Founder of StraitsX, had this to say about our journey in unlocking blockchain-enabled payments when he recently sat down for the latest instalment of the 'On Call withInsignia Ventures Partners' podcast series: 

"It’s almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD transacted on-chain… It’s beyond our [expectations] initially how this has come along. A lot of us here are big believers.. and technology is at the heart of what we do. We’re trying to solve problems. And we see that blockchain solutions do have merit to address things that traditional centralised systems [otherwise] cannot do. And that’s why we have been very focused and interested in the [real-world] application of stablecoins."

Listen to Part 1 of the podcast below, and keep a look out for Part 2 soon! 33,757 followers 🎙️ New podcast episode 🚀 4 impacts ofStraitsXin-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of fiat-backed stablecoins XSGD and XUSD

This week’s episode has returning guestTianwei Liu, Deputy CEO of Southeast Asia#fintechgroupFazz, the company behind digital asset infrastructure providerStraitsX. 

In 2023’sSingapore FinTech Festival, StraitsX received in-principle approval by the MAS for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD, opening up opportunities we cover in this first half of our call with the seasoned fintech#entrepreneur. 

1️⃣ For Fazz: building on five years of pioneering blockchain transactions to unlock more inter-currency corridors

🎙️ “It's almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD has been transacted on-chain...it gives us the confidence that this is going to be a regulated industry...and beyond the Singapore dollars...we are now able to issue G10 currency stablecoins out of Singapore with this new license regime and XUSD, which is what we're gonna be focusing our effort on in the coming years.”

2️⃣ For Singapore and ASEAN: More mainstream adoption with increased credibility and trust from regulators and institutions

🎙️ “It brings about the credibility that using this kind of medium to facilitate innovation in payment is the way that regulators around the world should be looking at this...It allows service providers like us and other players to be able to confidently say that what we are doing is regulated and we are doing this according to the standards needed both on the AML control side, as well on custody and the way that we safeguard the user's funds.”

3️⃣ For merchants and end-consumers: The same transactions, but faster, cheaper, and more interoperable thanks to blockchain technology (we cover the case of StraitsX collaborating with Grabpay and Alipay)

🎙️ “We can make this purpose-bound money the most purposeful and compliant by design...So the ML and compliance risk can be ring-fenced and properly controlled. Settlement will be instantaneous. Then the FX ability of the blockchain...can happen at a microtransaction level.”

4️⃣ For payments industry: Moving forward momentum of innovation (that comes in stages)

🎙️ “First, increase the acceptance and make sure that it's as seamless as possible without drop off rate. Then you go into costs. Can I make sure my cost is as low as possible, especially for cross border...Then the innovation, which is free game for a lot of guys to come in.”

👉 See the rest of the insights and the full podcast on Insignia Business Review:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9t👀 Or watch it on

Today we share a timely story on the value of localizing frontier technologies like digital assets on a regulatory and compliance level

This isTianwei Liu, Group Deputy CEO ofFazz. (Photo taken from when we took our limited partners to visit the Singapore Fazz office for our Annual Summit)

Tianwei is an engineer who returned to Singapore from Silicon Valley, and in 2015 started a payments infrastructure company thanks in part to some cross-border Christmas gift experiences (he shares more in our podcast). Along the way, an initiative came about internally to develop Singapore’s first regulated stablecoin throughStraitsX. 

Fast forward to 2023, their work in maturing this stablecoin marked a new milestone in last week’sSingapore FinTech Festival.

In a speech (see link in the comments), theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)’s Managing Director Ravi Menon also announced that “MAS has granted in-principle approval under the Payment Services Act to three entities who will issue stable coins that substantively comply with MAS’ upcoming stablecoin regulatory framework…Once the legislative amendments take effect, these stable coins will be regarded as “MAS-regulated stablecoins”. These includeStraitsXSGD issuance that will house the XSGD pegged stablecoin already on the market, and StraitsX USD Issuance. 

This is a step forward in developing a truly sustainable digital currency. And through Project Orchid, well-regulated stable coins are already being trialled for use cases like purpose-bound money. For example, StraitsX enables XSGD-backed purpose-bound money to facilitate escrow arrangements in e-commerce transactions, ensuring that funds are released to merchants only when the customer receives the purchased items. It was also tested in the Festival, in partnership with Amazon and Grab.

This development comes full circle to what Tianwei shared on our podcast a year ago: 
“You’re going to have a world that is going to be nominated in US dollars, everything is US dollars-based, but day-to-day wise, do we ever see a US dollar and we will use it as the ultimate payment [method]? 

I don’t think that will ever happen. So we need to figure out how to make sure that there is a thriving decentralized finance ecosystem in the Asia Pacific. Be it Singaporean dollars, Indonesia rupiah, Philippine pesos or in Vietnamese dong, it has to be built out by the locals, and that will require us to be the pioneers. And actually working very closely with regulators to build out that ecosystem for ourselves.” 

Localization for startups is no longer just a matter of developing products for a specific market, but ensuring that the business is operationally compliant with local regulations. This presents an even greater competitive advantage for startups able to develop their compliance muscle. 

Kudos to Tianwei and the StraitsX team for this milestone!#digitalassets#sff2023#straitsx#fazz#IVPAnnualSummit2023

profile_bio:
StraitsX is the pioneering payments infrastructure for the digital assets space in Southeast Asia. It is a Major Payment Institution licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore. 

StraitsX offers personal and business accounts to transfer and hold funds as well as to connect accounts to digital asset platforms. Business accounts can also access B2B API-enabled payments rails for digital asset platforms. 

StraitsX issues the Singapore Dollar-backed stablecoin, XSGD & Indonesian Rupiah-backed stablecoin.

StraitsX is a brand under Fazz, backed and supported by prominent investors including Tiger Global, Insignia Venture Partners, B Capital, BRI Ventures.

For more information, please visit straitsx.com.

🎙ICYMI: Our CEO and Co-Founder,Tianwei Liusat down withInsignia Ventures Partnersfor a two-part podcast; sharing insights and personal learnings from developing regulatory and compliance maturity across seven years of pioneering#fintechinfrastructure solutions out of Singapore and more than ten years of#entrepreneurship.

🎧 Catch up on both parts today:
Part 1:https://lnkd.in/gp8Af8GMPart 2:https://lnkd.in/gpSCRh5f 33,804 followers 🎙️ Part 2 of this week's#podcastwithFazzDeputy CEOTianwei Liu🚀 5#Regulationand#compliancelearnings from 10+ years pioneering#fintechsolutions out of#Singapore🇸🇬

InSingapore FinTech Festival2023, Fazz's digital asset infrastructure business StraitsX received in-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD stablecoins, opening up opportunities we covered in part 1:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9tPart 2 goes into learnings developing regulatory and compliance maturity from 7+ years pioneering fintech infrastructure solutions out of Singapore 

1️⃣ Continuous dialogue is key. 

🎙️ “...for compliance and fintech, talking to regulators, having an open dialogue, showing consistency and who's the person behind the company and what are you trying to achieve here...builds trust and credibility.”

2️⃣ A culture of customer-centric compliance is even more important to set the pace of product development, especially when developers are layers away from end-consumers. 

🎙️ “...“move fast and break things” does not apply here. In payments and fintech, you can't break things...You actually have to set the culture to do things right the first time and consider the impact on the customers and on people…”

3️⃣ Participate in regulatory sandboxes and make the most of regulatory openness to experimentation.

🎙️ “[They] allow you to basically do the smallest field experiments, to demonstrate certain things before getting to your bigger customers…”

4️⃣ Regulation opens doors to previously inaccessible market segments (e.g., FIs and banks) but the product makes the first step. 

🎙️ “Getting these licenses and compliance helps to give you a stamp of approval. It is not enough, but it's definitely more helpful to at least help education move along. It also means that institutions are able then to adopt this blockchain technology...you can then serve a wider customer that traditionally would either be fearful or unable to reach.”

5️⃣ Time and place matter when it comes to regulation. There are also regulatory blue oceans as well and this factors into the growth potential of the business. 

“Singapore is in a perfect position to do it, because of the regulation regime where you probably would think about China and other jurisdictions being geopolitically sensitive as well...potentially, this means for the whole entire region there will be a lot more adoption given that now Singapore has set the bar down.”

Tianwei Liu, CEO & Co-Founder of StraitsX, had this to say about our journey in unlocking blockchain-enabled payments when he recently sat down for the latest instalment of the 'On Call withInsignia Ventures Partners' podcast series: 

"It’s almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD transacted on-chain… It’s beyond our [expectations] initially how this has come along. A lot of us here are big believers.. and technology is at the heart of what we do. We’re trying to solve problems. And we see that blockchain solutions do have merit to address things that traditional centralised systems [otherwise] cannot do. And that’s why we have been very focused and interested in the [real-world] application of stablecoins."

Listen to Part 1 of the podcast below, and keep a look out for Part 2 soon! 33,804 followers 🎙️ New podcast episode 🚀 4 impacts ofStraitsXin-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of fiat-backed stablecoins XSGD and XUSD

This week’s episode has returning guestTianwei Liu, Deputy CEO of Southeast Asia#fintechgroupFazz, the company behind digital asset infrastructure providerStraitsX. 

In 2023’sSingapore FinTech Festival, StraitsX received in-principle approval by the MAS for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD, opening up opportunities we cover in this first half of our call with the seasoned fintech#entrepreneur. 

1️⃣ For Fazz: building on five years of pioneering blockchain transactions to unlock more inter-currency corridors

🎙️ “It's almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD has been transacted on-chain...it gives us the confidence that this is going to be a regulated industry...and beyond the Singapore dollars...we are now able to issue G10 currency stablecoins out of Singapore with this new license regime and XUSD, which is what we're gonna be focusing our effort on in the coming years.”

2️⃣ For Singapore and ASEAN: More mainstream adoption with increased credibility and trust from regulators and institutions

🎙️ “It brings about the credibility that using this kind of medium to facilitate innovation in payment is the way that regulators around the world should be looking at this...It allows service providers like us and other players to be able to confidently say that what we are doing is regulated and we are doing this according to the standards needed both on the AML control side, as well on custody and the way that we safeguard the user's funds.”

3️⃣ For merchants and end-consumers: The same transactions, but faster, cheaper, and more interoperable thanks to blockchain technology (we cover the case of StraitsX collaborating with Grabpay and Alipay)

🎙️ “We can make this purpose-bound money the most purposeful and compliant by design...So the ML and compliance risk can be ring-fenced and properly controlled. Settlement will be instantaneous. Then the FX ability of the blockchain...can happen at a microtransaction level.”

4️⃣ For payments industry: Moving forward momentum of innovation (that comes in stages)

🎙️ “First, increase the acceptance and make sure that it's as seamless as possible without drop off rate. Then you go into costs. Can I make sure my cost is as low as possible, especially for cross border...Then the innovation, which is free game for a lot of guys to come in.”

Today we share a timely story on the value of localizing frontier technologies like digital assets on a regulatory and compliance level

This isTianwei Liu, Group Deputy CEO ofFazz. (Photo taken from when we took our limited partners to visit the Singapore Fazz office for our Annual Summit)

Tianwei is an engineer who returned to Singapore from Silicon Valley, and in 2015 started a payments infrastructure company thanks in part to some cross-border Christmas gift experiences (he shares more in our podcast). Along the way, an initiative came about internally to develop Singapore’s first regulated stablecoin throughStraitsX. 

Fast forward to 2023, their work in maturing this stablecoin marked a new milestone in last week’sSingapore FinTech Festival.

In a speech (see link in the comments), theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)’s Managing Director Ravi Menon also announced that “MAS has granted in-principle approval under the Payment Services Act to three entities who will issue stable coins that substantively comply with MAS’ upcoming stablecoin regulatory framework…Once the legislative amendments take effect, these stable coins will be regarded as “MAS-regulated stablecoins”. These includeStraitsXSGD issuance that will house the XSGD pegged stablecoin already on the market, and StraitsX USD Issuance. 

This is a step forward in developing a truly sustainable digital currency. And through Project Orchid, well-regulated stable coins are already being trialled for use cases like purpose-bound money. For example, StraitsX enables XSGD-backed purpose-bound money to facilitate escrow arrangements in e-commerce transactions, ensuring that funds are released to merchants only when the customer receives the purchased items. It was also tested in the Festival, in partnership with Amazon and Grab.

This development comes full circle to what Tianwei shared on our podcast a year ago: 
“You’re going to have a world that is going to be nominated in US dollars, everything is US dollars-based, but day-to-day wise, do we ever see a US dollar and we will use it as the ultimate payment [method]? 

I don’t think that will ever happen. So we need to figure out how to make sure that there is a thriving decentralized finance ecosystem in the Asia Pacific. Be it Singaporean dollars, Indonesia rupiah, Philippine pesos or in Vietnamese dong, it has to be built out by the locals, and that will require us to be the pioneers. And actually working very closely with regulators to build out that ecosystem for ourselves.” 

Localization for startups is no longer just a matter of developing products for a specific market, but ensuring that the business is operationally compliant with local regulations. This presents an even greater competitive advantage for startups able to develop their compliance muscle. 

Kudos to Tianwei and the StraitsX team for this milestone!#digitalassets#sff2023#straitsx#fazz#IVPAnnualSummit2023

profile_bio:
StraitsX is the pioneering payments infrastructure for the digital assets space in Southeast Asia. It is a Major Payment Institution licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore. 

StraitsX offers personal and business accounts to transfer and hold funds as well as to connect accounts to digital asset platforms. Business accounts can also access B2B API-enabled payments rails for digital asset platforms. 

StraitsX issues the Singapore Dollar-backed stablecoin, XSGD & Indonesian Rupiah-backed stablecoin.

StraitsX is a brand under Fazz, backed and supported by prominent investors including Tiger Global, Insignia Venture Partners, B Capital, BRI Ventures.

For more information, please visit straitsx.com.

🎙ICYMI: Our CEO and Co-Founder,Tianwei Liusat down withInsignia Ventures Partnersfor a two-part podcast; sharing insights and personal learnings from developing regulatory and compliance maturity across seven years of pioneering#fintechinfrastructure solutions out of Singapore and more than ten years of#entrepreneurship.

🎧 Catch up on both parts today:
Part 1:https://lnkd.in/gp8Af8GMPart 2:https://lnkd.in/gpSCRh5f 33,825 followers 🎙️ Part 2 of this week's#podcastwithFazzDeputy CEOTianwei Liu🚀 5#Regulationand#compliancelearnings from 10+ years pioneering#fintechsolutions out of#Singapore🇸🇬

InSingapore FinTech Festival2023, Fazz's digital asset infrastructure business StraitsX received in-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD stablecoins, opening up opportunities we covered in part 1:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9tPart 2 goes into learnings developing regulatory and compliance maturity from 7+ years pioneering fintech infrastructure solutions out of Singapore 

1️⃣ Continuous dialogue is key. 

🎙️ “...for compliance and fintech, talking to regulators, having an open dialogue, showing consistency and who's the person behind the company and what are you trying to achieve here...builds trust and credibility.”

2️⃣ A culture of customer-centric compliance is even more important to set the pace of product development, especially when developers are layers away from end-consumers. 

🎙️ “...“move fast and break things” does not apply here. In payments and fintech, you can't break things...You actually have to set the culture to do things right the first time and consider the impact on the customers and on people…”

3️⃣ Participate in regulatory sandboxes and make the most of regulatory openness to experimentation.

🎙️ “[They] allow you to basically do the smallest field experiments, to demonstrate certain things before getting to your bigger customers…”

4️⃣ Regulation opens doors to previously inaccessible market segments (e.g., FIs and banks) but the product makes the first step. 

🎙️ “Getting these licenses and compliance helps to give you a stamp of approval. It is not enough, but it's definitely more helpful to at least help education move along. It also means that institutions are able then to adopt this blockchain technology...you can then serve a wider customer that traditionally would either be fearful or unable to reach.”

5️⃣ Time and place matter when it comes to regulation. There are also regulatory blue oceans as well and this factors into the growth potential of the business. 

“Singapore is in a perfect position to do it, because of the regulation regime where you probably would think about China and other jurisdictions being geopolitically sensitive as well...potentially, this means for the whole entire region there will be a lot more adoption given that now Singapore has set the bar down.”

👉 See the rest of the insights:https://lnkd.in/gKcWyCYV👀 Or watch it on
Spotify:https://lnkd.in/g6D3_Z5vApple Podcasts:https://lnkd.in/gg36bWHNYouTube:https://lnkd.in/gKZ2aXRT

Tianwei Liu, CEO & Co-Founder of StraitsX, had this to say about our journey in unlocking blockchain-enabled payments when he recently sat down for the latest instalment of the 'On Call withInsignia Ventures Partners' podcast series: 

"It’s almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD transacted on-chain… It’s beyond our [expectations] initially how this has come along. A lot of us here are big believers.. and technology is at the heart of what we do. We’re trying to solve problems. And we see that blockchain solutions do have merit to address things that traditional centralised systems [otherwise] cannot do. And that’s why we have been very focused and interested in the [real-world] application of stablecoins."

Listen to Part 1 of the podcast below, and keep a look out for Part 2 soon! 33,825 followers 🎙️ New podcast episode 🚀 4 impacts ofStraitsXin-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of fiat-backed stablecoins XSGD and XUSD

This week’s episode has returning guestTianwei Liu, Deputy CEO of Southeast Asia#fintechgroupFazz, the company behind digital asset infrastructure providerStraitsX. 

In 2023’sSingapore FinTech Festival, StraitsX received in-principle approval by the MAS for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD, opening up opportunities we cover in this first half of our call with the seasoned fintech#entrepreneur. 

1️⃣ For Fazz: building on five years of pioneering blockchain transactions to unlock more inter-currency corridors

🎙️ “It's almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD has been transacted on-chain...it gives us the confidence that this is going to be a regulated industry...and beyond the Singapore dollars...we are now able to issue G10 currency stablecoins out of Singapore with this new license regime and XUSD, which is what we're gonna be focusing our effort on in the coming years.”

2️⃣ For Singapore and ASEAN: More mainstream adoption with increased credibility and trust from regulators and institutions

🎙️ “It brings about the credibility that using this kind of medium to facilitate innovation in payment is the way that regulators around the world should be looking at this...It allows service providers like us and other players to be able to confidently say that what we are doing is regulated and we are doing this according to the standards needed both on the AML control side, as well on custody and the way that we safeguard the user's funds.”

3️⃣ For merchants and end-consumers: The same transactions, but faster, cheaper, and more interoperable thanks to blockchain technology (we cover the case of StraitsX collaborating with Grabpay and Alipay)

🎙️ “We can make this purpose-bound money the most purposeful and compliant by design...So the ML and compliance risk can be ring-fenced and properly controlled. Settlement will be instantaneous. Then the FX ability of the blockchain...can happen at a microtransaction level.”

4️⃣ For payments industry: Moving forward momentum of innovation (that comes in stages)

🎙️ “First, increase the acceptance and make sure that it's as seamless as possible without drop off rate. Then you go into costs. Can I make sure my cost is as low as possible, especially for cross border...Then the innovation, which is free game for a lot of guys to come in.”

👉 See the rest of the insights and the full podcast on Insignia Business Review:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9t👀 Or watch it on
Spotify:https://lnkd.in/gVbMjfSCApple Podcasts:https://lnkd.in/gyiryNiXYouTube:youtu.be/y-kEDB-ge_A📸 Photo from StraitsX

🎙ICYMI: Our CEO and Co-Founder,Tianwei Liusat down withInsignia Ventures Partnersfor a two-part podcast; sharing insights and personal learnings from developing regulatory and compliance maturity across seven years of pioneering#fintechinfrastructure solutions out of Singapore and more than ten years of#entrepreneurship.

🎧 Catch up on both parts today:
Part 1:https://lnkd.in/gp8Af8GMPart 2:https://lnkd.in/gpSCRh5f 33,851 followers 🎙️ Part 2 of this week's#podcastwithFazzDeputy CEOTianwei Liu🚀 5#Regulationand#compliancelearnings from 10+ years pioneering#fintechsolutions out of#Singapore🇸🇬

InSingapore FinTech Festival2023, Fazz's digital asset infrastructure business StraitsX received in-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD stablecoins, opening up opportunities we covered in part 1:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9tPart 2 goes into learnings developing regulatory and compliance maturity from 7+ years pioneering fintech infrastructure solutions out of Singapore 

1️⃣ Continuous dialogue is key. 

🎙️ “...for compliance and fintech, talking to regulators, having an open dialogue, showing consistency and who's the person behind the company and what are you trying to achieve here...builds trust and credibility.”

2️⃣ A culture of customer-centric compliance is even more important to set the pace of product development, especially when developers are layers away from end-consumers. 

🎙️ “...“move fast and break things” does not apply here. In payments and fintech, you can't break things...You actually have to set the culture to do things right the first time and consider the impact on the customers and on people…”

3️⃣ Participate in regulatory sandboxes and make the most of regulatory openness to experimentation.

🎙️ “[They] allow you to basically do the smallest field experiments, to demonstrate certain things before getting to your bigger customers…”

4️⃣ Regulation opens doors to previously inaccessible market segments (e.g., FIs and banks) but the product makes the first step. 

🎙️ “Getting these licenses and compliance helps to give you a stamp of approval. It is not enough, but it's definitely more helpful to at least help education move along. It also means that institutions are able then to adopt this blockchain technology...you can then serve a wider customer that traditionally would either be fearful or unable to reach.”

5️⃣ Time and place matter when it comes to regulation. There are also regulatory blue oceans as well and this factors into the growth potential of the business. 

“Singapore is in a perfect position to do it, because of the regulation regime where you probably would think about China and other jurisdictions being geopolitically sensitive as well...potentially, this means for the whole entire region there will be a lot more adoption given that now Singapore has set the bar down.”

Tianwei Liu, CEO & Co-Founder of StraitsX, had this to say about our journey in unlocking blockchain-enabled payments when he recently sat down for the latest instalment of the 'On Call withInsignia Ventures Partners' podcast series: 

"It’s almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD transacted on-chain… It’s beyond our [expectations] initially how this has come along. A lot of us here are big believers.. and technology is at the heart of what we do. We’re trying to solve problems. And we see that blockchain solutions do have merit to address things that traditional centralised systems [otherwise] cannot do. And that’s why we have been very focused and interested in the [real-world] application of stablecoins."

Listen to Part 1 of the podcast below, and keep a look out for Part 2 soon! 33,851 followers 🎙️ New podcast episode 🚀 4 impacts ofStraitsXin-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of fiat-backed stablecoins XSGD and XUSD

This week’s episode has returning guestTianwei Liu, Deputy CEO of Southeast Asia#fintechgroupFazz, the company behind digital asset infrastructure providerStraitsX. 

In 2023’sSingapore FinTech Festival, StraitsX received in-principle approval by the MAS for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD, opening up opportunities we cover in this first half of our call with the seasoned fintech#entrepreneur. 

1️⃣ For Fazz: building on five years of pioneering blockchain transactions to unlock more inter-currency corridors

🎙️ “It's almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD has been transacted on-chain...it gives us the confidence that this is going to be a regulated industry...and beyond the Singapore dollars...we are now able to issue G10 currency stablecoins out of Singapore with this new license regime and XUSD, which is what we're gonna be focusing our effort on in the coming years.”

2️⃣ For Singapore and ASEAN: More mainstream adoption with increased credibility and trust from regulators and institutions

🎙️ “It brings about the credibility that using this kind of medium to facilitate innovation in payment is the way that regulators around the world should be looking at this...It allows service providers like us and other players to be able to confidently say that what we are doing is regulated and we are doing this according to the standards needed both on the AML control side, as well on custody and the way that we safeguard the user's funds.”

3️⃣ For merchants and end-consumers: The same transactions, but faster, cheaper, and more interoperable thanks to blockchain technology (we cover the case of StraitsX collaborating with Grabpay and Alipay)

🎙️ “We can make this purpose-bound money the most purposeful and compliant by design...So the ML and compliance risk can be ring-fenced and properly controlled. Settlement will be instantaneous. Then the FX ability of the blockchain...can happen at a microtransaction level.”

4️⃣ For payments industry: Moving forward momentum of innovation (that comes in stages)

🎙️ “First, increase the acceptance and make sure that it's as seamless as possible without drop off rate. Then you go into costs. Can I make sure my cost is as low as possible, especially for cross border...Then the innovation, which is free game for a lot of guys to come in.”

Today we share a timely story on the value of localizing frontier technologies like digital assets on a regulatory and compliance level

This isTianwei Liu, Group Deputy CEO ofFazz. (Photo taken from when we took our limited partners to visit the Singapore Fazz office for our Annual Summit)

Tianwei is an engineer who returned to Singapore from Silicon Valley, and in 2015 started a payments infrastructure company thanks in part to some cross-border Christmas gift experiences (he shares more in our podcast). Along the way, an initiative came about internally to develop Singapore’s first regulated stablecoin throughStraitsX. 

Fast forward to 2023, their work in maturing this stablecoin marked a new milestone in last week’sSingapore FinTech Festival.

In a speech (see link in the comments), theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)’s Managing Director Ravi Menon also announced that “MAS has granted in-principle approval under the Payment Services Act to three entities who will issue stable coins that substantively comply with MAS’ upcoming stablecoin regulatory framework…Once the legislative amendments take effect, these stable coins will be regarded as “MAS-regulated stablecoins”. These includeStraitsXSGD issuance that will house the XSGD pegged stablecoin already on the market, and StraitsX USD Issuance. 

This is a step forward in developing a truly sustainable digital currency. And through Project Orchid, well-regulated stable coins are already being trialled for use cases like purpose-bound money. For example, StraitsX enables XSGD-backed purpose-bound money to facilitate escrow arrangements in e-commerce transactions, ensuring that funds are released to merchants only when the customer receives the purchased items. It was also tested in the Festival, in partnership with Amazon and Grab.

This development comes full circle to what Tianwei shared on our podcast a year ago: 
“You’re going to have a world that is going to be nominated in US dollars, everything is US dollars-based, but day-to-day wise, do we ever see a US dollar and we will use it as the ultimate payment [method]? 

I don’t think that will ever happen. So we need to figure out how to make sure that there is a thriving decentralized finance ecosystem in the Asia Pacific. Be it Singaporean dollars, Indonesia rupiah, Philippine pesos or in Vietnamese dong, it has to be built out by the locals, and that will require us to be the pioneers. And actually working very closely with regulators to build out that ecosystem for ourselves.” 

Localization for startups is no longer just a matter of developing products for a specific market, but ensuring that the business is operationally compliant with local regulations. This presents an even greater competitive advantage for startups able to develop their compliance muscle. 

Kudos to Tianwei and the StraitsX team for this milestone!#digitalassets#sff2023#straitsx#fazz#IVPAnnualSummit2023

profile_bio:
StraitsX is the pioneering payments infrastructure for the digital assets space in Southeast Asia. It is a Major Payment Institution licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore. 

StraitsX offers personal and business accounts to transfer and hold funds as well as to connect accounts to digital asset platforms. Business accounts can also access B2B API-enabled payments rails for digital asset platforms. 

StraitsX issues the Singapore Dollar-backed stablecoin, XSGD & Indonesian Rupiah-backed stablecoin.

StraitsX is a brand under Fazz, backed and supported by prominent investors including Tiger Global, Insignia Venture Partners, B Capital, BRI Ventures.

For more information, please visit straitsx.com.

🎙ICYMI: Our CEO and Co-Founder,Tianwei Liusat down withInsignia Ventures Partnersfor a two-part podcast; sharing insights and personal learnings from developing regulatory and compliance maturity across seven years of pioneering#fintechinfrastructure solutions out of Singapore and more than ten years of#entrepreneurship.

🎧 Catch up on both parts today:
Part 1:https://lnkd.in/gp8Af8GMPart 2:https://lnkd.in/gpSCRh5f 33,882 followers 🎙️ Part 2 of this week's#podcastwithFazzDeputy CEOTianwei Liu🚀 5#Regulationand#compliancelearnings from 10+ years pioneering#fintechsolutions out of#Singapore🇸🇬

InSingapore FinTech Festival2023, Fazz's digital asset infrastructure business StraitsX received in-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD stablecoins, opening up opportunities we covered in part 1:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9tPart 2 goes into learnings developing regulatory and compliance maturity from 7+ years pioneering fintech infrastructure solutions out of Singapore 

1️⃣ Continuous dialogue is key. 

🎙️ “...for compliance and fintech, talking to regulators, having an open dialogue, showing consistency and who's the person behind the company and what are you trying to achieve here...builds trust and credibility.”

2️⃣ A culture of customer-centric compliance is even more important to set the pace of product development, especially when developers are layers away from end-consumers. 

🎙️ “...“move fast and break things” does not apply here. In payments and fintech, you can't break things...You actually have to set the culture to do things right the first time and consider the impact on the customers and on people…”

3️⃣ Participate in regulatory sandboxes and make the most of regulatory openness to experimentation.

🎙️ “[They] allow you to basically do the smallest field experiments, to demonstrate certain things before getting to your bigger customers…”

4️⃣ Regulation opens doors to previously inaccessible market segments (e.g., FIs and banks) but the product makes the first step. 

🎙️ “Getting these licenses and compliance helps to give you a stamp of approval. It is not enough, but it's definitely more helpful to at least help education move along. It also means that institutions are able then to adopt this blockchain technology...you can then serve a wider customer that traditionally would either be fearful or unable to reach.”

5️⃣ Time and place matter when it comes to regulation. There are also regulatory blue oceans as well and this factors into the growth potential of the business. 

“Singapore is in a perfect position to do it, because of the regulation regime where you probably would think about China and other jurisdictions being geopolitically sensitive as well...potentially, this means for the whole entire region there will be a lot more adoption given that now Singapore has set the bar down.”
