🎙ICYMI: Our CEO and Co-Founder,Tianwei Liusat down withInsignia Ventures Partnersfor a two-part podcast; sharing insights and personal learnings from developing regulatory and compliance maturity across seven years of pioneering#fintechinfrastructure solutions out of Singapore and more than ten years of#entrepreneurship.

🎧 Catch up on both parts today:
Part 1:https://lnkd.in/gp8Af8GMPart 2:https://lnkd.in/gpSCRh5f 34,191 followers 🎙️ Part 2 of this week's#podcastwithFazzDeputy CEOTianwei Liu🚀 5#Regulationand#compliancelearnings from 10+ years pioneering#fintechsolutions out of#Singapore🇸🇬

InSingapore FinTech Festival2023, Fazz's digital asset infrastructure business StraitsX received in-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD stablecoins, opening up opportunities we covered in part 1:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9tPart 2 goes into learnings developing regulatory and compliance maturity from 7+ years pioneering fintech infrastructure solutions out of Singapore 

1️⃣ Continuous dialogue is key. 

🎙️ “...for compliance and fintech, talking to regulators, having an open dialogue, showing consistency and who's the person behind the company and what are you trying to achieve here...builds trust and credibility.”

2️⃣ A culture of customer-centric compliance is even more important to set the pace of product development, especially when developers are layers away from end-consumers. 

🎙️ “...“move fast and break things” does not apply here. In payments and fintech, you can't break things...You actually have to set the culture to do things right the first time and consider the impact on the customers and on people…”

3️⃣ Participate in regulatory sandboxes and make the most of regulatory openness to experimentation.

🎙️ “[They] allow you to basically do the smallest field experiments, to demonstrate certain things before getting to your bigger customers…”

4️⃣ Regulation opens doors to previously inaccessible market segments (e.g., FIs and banks) but the product makes the first step. 

🎙️ “Getting these licenses and compliance helps to give you a stamp of approval. It is not enough, but it's definitely more helpful to at least help education move along. It also means that institutions are able then to adopt this blockchain technology...you can then serve a wider customer that traditionally would either be fearful or unable to reach.”

5️⃣ Time and place matter when it comes to regulation. There are also regulatory blue oceans as well and this factors into the growth potential of the business. 

“Singapore is in a perfect position to do it, because of the regulation regime where you probably would think about China and other jurisdictions being geopolitically sensitive as well...potentially, this means for the whole entire region there will be a lot more adoption given that now Singapore has set the bar down.”

Tianwei Liu, CEO & Co-Founder of StraitsX, had this to say about our journey in unlocking blockchain-enabled payments when he recently sat down for the latest instalment of the 'On Call withInsignia Ventures Partners' podcast series: 

"It’s almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD transacted on-chain… It’s beyond our [expectations] initially how this has come along. A lot of us here are big believers.. and technology is at the heart of what we do. We’re trying to solve problems. And we see that blockchain solutions do have merit to address things that traditional centralised systems [otherwise] cannot do. And that’s why we have been very focused and interested in the [real-world] application of stablecoins."

Listen to Part 1 of the podcast below, and keep a look out for Part 2 soon! 34,191 followers 🎙️ New podcast episode 🚀 4 impacts ofStraitsXin-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of fiat-backed stablecoins XSGD and XUSD

This week’s episode has returning guestTianwei Liu, Deputy CEO of Southeast Asia#fintechgroupFazz, the company behind digital asset infrastructure providerStraitsX. 

In 2023’sSingapore FinTech Festival, StraitsX received in-principle approval by the MAS for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD, opening up opportunities we cover in this first half of our call with the seasoned fintech#entrepreneur. 

1️⃣ For Fazz: building on five years of pioneering blockchain transactions to unlock more inter-currency corridors

🎙️ “It's almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD has been transacted on-chain...it gives us the confidence that this is going to be a regulated industry...and beyond the Singapore dollars...we are now able to issue G10 currency stablecoins out of Singapore with this new license regime and XUSD, which is what we're gonna be focusing our effort on in the coming years.”

2️⃣ For Singapore and ASEAN: More mainstream adoption with increased credibility and trust from regulators and institutions

🎙️ “It brings about the credibility that using this kind of medium to facilitate innovation in payment is the way that regulators around the world should be looking at this...It allows service providers like us and other players to be able to confidently say that what we are doing is regulated and we are doing this according to the standards needed both on the AML control side, as well on custody and the way that we safeguard the user's funds.”

3️⃣ For merchants and end-consumers: The same transactions, but faster, cheaper, and more interoperable thanks to blockchain technology (we cover the case of StraitsX collaborating with Grabpay and Alipay)

🎙️ “We can make this purpose-bound money the most purposeful and compliant by design...So the ML and compliance risk can be ring-fenced and properly controlled. Settlement will be instantaneous. Then the FX ability of the blockchain...can happen at a microtransaction level.”

4️⃣ For payments industry: Moving forward momentum of innovation (that comes in stages)

🎙️ “First, increase the acceptance and make sure that it's as seamless as possible without drop off rate. Then you go into costs. Can I make sure my cost is as low as possible, especially for cross border...Then the innovation, which is free game for a lot of guys to come in.”

Today we share a timely story on the value of localizing frontier technologies like digital assets on a regulatory and compliance level

This isTianwei Liu, Group Deputy CEO ofFazz. (Photo taken from when we took our limited partners to visit the Singapore Fazz office for our Annual Summit)

Tianwei is an engineer who returned to Singapore from Silicon Valley, and in 2015 started a payments infrastructure company thanks in part to some cross-border Christmas gift experiences (he shares more in our podcast). Along the way, an initiative came about internally to develop Singapore’s first regulated stablecoin throughStraitsX. 

Fast forward to 2023, their work in maturing this stablecoin marked a new milestone in last week’sSingapore FinTech Festival.

In a speech (see link in the comments), theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)’s Managing Director Ravi Menon also announced that “MAS has granted in-principle approval under the Payment Services Act to three entities who will issue stable coins that substantively comply with MAS’ upcoming stablecoin regulatory framework…Once the legislative amendments take effect, these stable coins will be regarded as “MAS-regulated stablecoins”. These includeStraitsXSGD issuance that will house the XSGD pegged stablecoin already on the market, and StraitsX USD Issuance. 

This is a step forward in developing a truly sustainable digital currency. And through Project Orchid, well-regulated stable coins are already being trialled for use cases like purpose-bound money. For example, StraitsX enables XSGD-backed purpose-bound money to facilitate escrow arrangements in e-commerce transactions, ensuring that funds are released to merchants only when the customer receives the purchased items. It was also tested in the Festival, in partnership with Amazon and Grab.

This development comes full circle to what Tianwei shared on our podcast a year ago: 
“You’re going to have a world that is going to be nominated in US dollars, everything is US dollars-based, but day-to-day wise, do we ever see a US dollar and we will use it as the ultimate payment [method]? 

I don’t think that will ever happen. So we need to figure out how to make sure that there is a thriving decentralized finance ecosystem in the Asia Pacific. Be it Singaporean dollars, Indonesia rupiah, Philippine pesos or in Vietnamese dong, it has to be built out by the locals, and that will require us to be the pioneers. And actually working very closely with regulators to build out that ecosystem for ourselves.” 

Localization for startups is no longer just a matter of developing products for a specific market, but ensuring that the business is operationally compliant with local regulations. This presents an even greater competitive advantage for startups able to develop their compliance muscle. 

Kudos to Tianwei and the StraitsX team for this milestone!#digitalassets#sff2023#straitsx#fazz#IVPAnnualSummit2023

1. **Technological Advancements**: Blockchain resilience, compliance, open-source development grants.
2. **Educational Initiatives**: Collaborations to enhance digital asset education.
3. **Sustainability**: Using green energy for cryptocurrency mining.

These categories align with investor focus on security, compliance, education, and sustainability in the cryptocurrency market.

overall_prompt_summary: The posts exhibit characteristics of bot-generated content, such as lacking personal touches, using repetitive promotional language, and including multiple links. They focus on partnerships, compliance, and education without evidence of manipulation schemes or cryptocurrency channel invites. The most important issues are the repetitive and impersonal nature of the posts, which suggest automation. Additionally, the multiple links could be seen as spammy. To improve, incorporating more personal touches and reducing the number of links could make the content more engaging and authentic.

profile_bio:
StraitsX is the pioneering payments infrastructure for the digital assets space in Southeast Asia. It is a Major Payment Institution licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore. 

StraitsX offers personal and business accounts to transfer and hold funds as well as to connect accounts to digital asset platforms. Business accounts can also access B2B API-enabled payments rails for digital asset platforms. 

StraitsX issues the Singapore Dollar-backed stablecoin, XSGD & Indonesian Rupiah-backed stablecoin.

StraitsX is a brand under Fazz, backed and supported by prominent investors including Tiger Global, Insignia Venture Partners, B Capital, BRI Ventures.

For more information, please visit straitsx.com.

🎙ICYMI: Our CEO and Co-Founder,Tianwei Liusat down withInsignia Ventures Partnersfor a two-part podcast; sharing insights and personal learnings from developing regulatory and compliance maturity across seven years of pioneering#fintechinfrastructure solutions out of Singapore and more than ten years of#entrepreneurship.

🎧 Catch up on both parts today:
Part 1:https://lnkd.in/gp8Af8GMPart 2:https://lnkd.in/gpSCRh5f 34,221 followers 🎙️ Part 2 of this week's#podcastwithFazzDeputy CEOTianwei Liu🚀 5#Regulationand#compliancelearnings from 10+ years pioneering#fintechsolutions out of#Singapore🇸🇬

InSingapore FinTech Festival2023, Fazz's digital asset infrastructure business StraitsX received in-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD stablecoins, opening up opportunities we covered in part 1:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9tPart 2 goes into learnings developing regulatory and compliance maturity from 7+ years pioneering fintech infrastructure solutions out of Singapore 

1️⃣ Continuous dialogue is key. 

🎙️ “...for compliance and fintech, talking to regulators, having an open dialogue, showing consistency and who's the person behind the company and what are you trying to achieve here...builds trust and credibility.”

2️⃣ A culture of customer-centric compliance is even more important to set the pace of product development, especially when developers are layers away from end-consumers. 

🎙️ “...“move fast and break things” does not apply here. In payments and fintech, you can't break things...You actually have to set the culture to do things right the first time and consider the impact on the customers and on people…”

3️⃣ Participate in regulatory sandboxes and make the most of regulatory openness to experimentation.

🎙️ “[They] allow you to basically do the smallest field experiments, to demonstrate certain things before getting to your bigger customers…”

4️⃣ Regulation opens doors to previously inaccessible market segments (e.g., FIs and banks) but the product makes the first step. 

🎙️ “Getting these licenses and compliance helps to give you a stamp of approval. It is not enough, but it's definitely more helpful to at least help education move along. It also means that institutions are able then to adopt this blockchain technology...you can then serve a wider customer that traditionally would either be fearful or unable to reach.”

5️⃣ Time and place matter when it comes to regulation. There are also regulatory blue oceans as well and this factors into the growth potential of the business. 

“Singapore is in a perfect position to do it, because of the regulation regime where you probably would think about China and other jurisdictions being geopolitically sensitive as well...potentially, this means for the whole entire region there will be a lot more adoption given that now Singapore has set the bar down.”

👉 See the rest of the insights:https://lnkd.in/gKcWyCYV👀 Or watch it on
Spotify:https://lnkd.in/g6D3_Z5vApple Podcasts:https://lnkd.in/gg36bWHNYouTube:https://lnkd.in/gKZ2aXRT

Tianwei Liu, CEO & Co-Founder of StraitsX, had this to say about our journey in unlocking blockchain-enabled payments when he recently sat down for the latest instalment of the 'On Call withInsignia Ventures Partners' podcast series: 

"It’s almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD transacted on-chain… It’s beyond our [expectations] initially how this has come along. A lot of us here are big believers.. and technology is at the heart of what we do. We’re trying to solve problems. And we see that blockchain solutions do have merit to address things that traditional centralised systems [otherwise] cannot do. And that’s why we have been very focused and interested in the [real-world] application of stablecoins."

Listen to Part 1 of the podcast below, and keep a look out for Part 2 soon! 34,221 followers 🎙️ New podcast episode 🚀 4 impacts ofStraitsXin-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of fiat-backed stablecoins XSGD and XUSD

This week’s episode has returning guestTianwei Liu, Deputy CEO of Southeast Asia#fintechgroupFazz, the company behind digital asset infrastructure providerStraitsX. 

In 2023’sSingapore FinTech Festival, StraitsX received in-principle approval by the MAS for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD, opening up opportunities we cover in this first half of our call with the seasoned fintech#entrepreneur. 

1️⃣ For Fazz: building on five years of pioneering blockchain transactions to unlock more inter-currency corridors

🎙️ “It's almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD has been transacted on-chain...it gives us the confidence that this is going to be a regulated industry...and beyond the Singapore dollars...we are now able to issue G10 currency stablecoins out of Singapore with this new license regime and XUSD, which is what we're gonna be focusing our effort on in the coming years.”

2️⃣ For Singapore and ASEAN: More mainstream adoption with increased credibility and trust from regulators and institutions

🎙️ “It brings about the credibility that using this kind of medium to facilitate innovation in payment is the way that regulators around the world should be looking at this...It allows service providers like us and other players to be able to confidently say that what we are doing is regulated and we are doing this according to the standards needed both on the AML control side, as well on custody and the way that we safeguard the user's funds.”

3️⃣ For merchants and end-consumers: The same transactions, but faster, cheaper, and more interoperable thanks to blockchain technology (we cover the case of StraitsX collaborating with Grabpay and Alipay)

🎙️ “We can make this purpose-bound money the most purposeful and compliant by design...So the ML and compliance risk can be ring-fenced and properly controlled. Settlement will be instantaneous. Then the FX ability of the blockchain...can happen at a microtransaction level.”

4️⃣ For payments industry: Moving forward momentum of innovation (that comes in stages)

🎙️ “First, increase the acceptance and make sure that it's as seamless as possible without drop off rate. Then you go into costs. Can I make sure my cost is as low as possible, especially for cross border...Then the innovation, which is free game for a lot of guys to come in.”

👉 See the rest of the insights and the full podcast on Insignia Business Review:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9t👀 Or watch it on
Spotify:https://lnkd.in/gVbMjfSCApple Podcasts:https://lnkd.in/gyiryNiXYouTube:youtu.be/y-kEDB-ge_A📸 Photo from StraitsX

Today we share a timely story on the value of localizing frontier technologies like digital assets on a regulatory and compliance level

This isTianwei Liu, Group Deputy CEO ofFazz. (Photo taken from when we took our limited partners to visit the Singapore Fazz office for our Annual Summit)

Tianwei is an engineer who returned to Singapore from Silicon Valley, and in 2015 started a payments infrastructure company thanks in part to some cross-border Christmas gift experiences (he shares more in our podcast). Along the way, an initiative came about internally to develop Singapore’s first regulated stablecoin throughStraitsX. 

Fast forward to 2023, their work in maturing this stablecoin marked a new milestone in last week’sSingapore FinTech Festival.

In a speech (see link in the comments), theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)’s Managing Director Ravi Menon also announced that “MAS has granted in-principle approval under the Payment Services Act to three entities who will issue stable coins that substantively comply with MAS’ upcoming stablecoin regulatory framework…Once the legislative amendments take effect, these stable coins will be regarded as “MAS-regulated stablecoins”. These includeStraitsXSGD issuance that will house the XSGD pegged stablecoin already on the market, and StraitsX USD Issuance. 

This is a step forward in developing a truly sustainable digital currency. And through Project Orchid, well-regulated stable coins are already being trialled for use cases like purpose-bound money. For example, StraitsX enables XSGD-backed purpose-bound money to facilitate escrow arrangements in e-commerce transactions, ensuring that funds are released to merchants only when the customer receives the purchased items. It was also tested in the Festival, in partnership with Amazon and Grab.

This development comes full circle to what Tianwei shared on our podcast a year ago: 
“You’re going to have a world that is going to be nominated in US dollars, everything is US dollars-based, but day-to-day wise, do we ever see a US dollar and we will use it as the ultimate payment [method]? 

I don’t think that will ever happen. So we need to figure out how to make sure that there is a thriving decentralized finance ecosystem in the Asia Pacific. Be it Singaporean dollars, Indonesia rupiah, Philippine pesos or in Vietnamese dong, it has to be built out by the locals, and that will require us to be the pioneers. And actually working very closely with regulators to build out that ecosystem for ourselves.” 

Localization for startups is no longer just a matter of developing products for a specific market, but ensuring that the business is operationally compliant with local regulations. This presents an even greater competitive advantage for startups able to develop their compliance muscle. 

Kudos to Tianwei and the StraitsX team for this milestone!#digitalassets#sff2023#straitsx#fazz#IVPAnnualSummit2023

FOMO Paytakes pride in enabling Singapore’s Purpose Bound Money (#PBM) acceptance as the merchant acquirer of the Singapore Pitstop industry pilot, which builds on Project Orchid, aMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)’s project to build the technology infrastructure and technical expertise required to issue digital Singapore dollar and explore potential applications for programmable money in#Singapore.

prompts_output.Prompt: Assess these posts for insights into investor behavior, concerns, and expectations regarding cryptocurrencies. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts reveal that investors prioritize security, sustainability, and regulatory compliance in the cryptocurrency market. prompts_output.Prompt: Spot any emerging trends in topics discussed in these posts about the company. Are there any new developments, controversies, or milestones that are garnering attention? Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: Emerging trends include technological advancements, partnerships, and regulatory compliance, with a focus on security and sustainability. No new developments, controversies, or major milestones are evident.

prompts_output.Prompt: Identify any patterns or strategies in these posts that resemble known cryptocurrency manipulation tactics such as pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts do not exhibit patterns or strategies resembling cryptocurrency manipulation tactics like pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes; they focus on partnerships, technological advancements, and compliance without aggressive price promotion, unrealistic profit promises, or recruitment-based incentives.

prompts_output.Prompt: Analyze these posts to determine if any show characteristics of being generated by bots or automated accounts. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts show characteristics of bot-generated content, such as lack of personal engagement, promotional focus, uniformity, and multiple links, suggesting they are likely automated rather than authored by humans.

prompts_output.Prompt: Examine these posts for the presence of invite links to cryptocurrency channels or groups, and assess their potential role in manipulation schemes. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts lack invite links to cryptocurrency channels or groups and show no signs of manipulation schemes like pump-and-dump or Ponzi tactics, focusing instead on partnerships, technological advancements, and compliance.

prompts_output.Prompt: Categorize these posts based on their content and topics, focusing on how they relate to cryptocurrency market trends and investor behavior. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts fall into themes of technological advancements, partnerships, and regulatory compliance in the cryptocurrency market. overall_prompt_summary:
The posts focus on themes of technological advancements, partnerships, and regulatory compliance in the cryptocurrency market, reflecting investor priorities such as security, sustainability, and compliance. They exhibit characteristics of bot-generated promotional content without manipulation tactics. 

The most important issues highlighted include the emphasis on security and regulatory compliance, which are critical for investor confidence. Additionally, the focus on sustainability indicates a growing concern for environmentally friendly practices in the cryptocurrency industry. 

A potential improvement could be to incorporate more human-like engagement and personalized content to enhance authenticity and relatability.

profile_bio:
StraitsX is the pioneering payments infrastructure for the digital assets space in Southeast Asia. It is a Major Payment Institution licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore. 

StraitsX offers personal and business accounts to transfer and hold funds as well as to connect accounts to digital asset platforms. Business accounts can also access B2B API-enabled payments rails for digital asset platforms. 

StraitsX issues the Singapore Dollar-backed stablecoin, XSGD & Indonesian Rupiah-backed stablecoin.

StraitsX is a brand under Fazz, backed and supported by prominent investors including Tiger Global, Insignia Venture Partners, B Capital, BRI Ventures.

For more information, please visit straitsx.com.

🎙ICYMI: Our CEO and Co-Founder,Tianwei Liusat down withInsignia Ventures Partnersfor a two-part podcast; sharing insights and personal learnings from developing regulatory and compliance maturity across seven years of pioneering#fintechinfrastructure solutions out of Singapore and more than ten years of#entrepreneurship.

🎧 Catch up on both parts today:
Part 1:https://lnkd.in/gp8Af8GMPart 2:https://lnkd.in/gpSCRh5f 34,239 followers 🎙️ Part 2 of this week's#podcastwithFazzDeputy CEOTianwei Liu🚀 5#Regulationand#compliancelearnings from 10+ years pioneering#fintechsolutions out of#Singapore🇸🇬

InSingapore FinTech Festival2023, Fazz's digital asset infrastructure business StraitsX received in-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD stablecoins, opening up opportunities we covered in part 1:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9tPart 2 goes into learnings developing regulatory and compliance maturity from 7+ years pioneering fintech infrastructure solutions out of Singapore 

1️⃣ Continuous dialogue is key. 

🎙️ “...for compliance and fintech, talking to regulators, having an open dialogue, showing consistency and who's the person behind the company and what are you trying to achieve here...builds trust and credibility.”

2️⃣ A culture of customer-centric compliance is even more important to set the pace of product development, especially when developers are layers away from end-consumers. 

🎙️ “...“move fast and break things” does not apply here. In payments and fintech, you can't break things...You actually have to set the culture to do things right the first time and consider the impact on the customers and on people…”

3️⃣ Participate in regulatory sandboxes and make the most of regulatory openness to experimentation.

🎙️ “[They] allow you to basically do the smallest field experiments, to demonstrate certain things before getting to your bigger customers…”

4️⃣ Regulation opens doors to previously inaccessible market segments (e.g., FIs and banks) but the product makes the first step. 

🎙️ “Getting these licenses and compliance helps to give you a stamp of approval. It is not enough, but it's definitely more helpful to at least help education move along. It also means that institutions are able then to adopt this blockchain technology...you can then serve a wider customer that traditionally would either be fearful or unable to reach.”

5️⃣ Time and place matter when it comes to regulation. There are also regulatory blue oceans as well and this factors into the growth potential of the business. 

“Singapore is in a perfect position to do it, because of the regulation regime where you probably would think about China and other jurisdictions being geopolitically sensitive as well...potentially, this means for the whole entire region there will be a lot more adoption given that now Singapore has set the bar down.”

👉 See the rest of the insights:https://lnkd.in/gKcWyCYV👀 Or watch it on
Spotify:https://lnkd.in/g6D3_Z5vApple Podcasts:https://lnkd.in/gg36bWHNYouTube:https://lnkd.in/gKZ2aXRT

Tianwei Liu, CEO & Co-Founder of StraitsX, had this to say about our journey in unlocking blockchain-enabled payments when he recently sat down for the latest instalment of the 'On Call withInsignia Ventures Partners' podcast series: 

"It’s almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD transacted on-chain… It’s beyond our [expectations] initially how this has come along. A lot of us here are big believers.. and technology is at the heart of what we do. We’re trying to solve problems. And we see that blockchain solutions do have merit to address things that traditional centralised systems [otherwise] cannot do. And that’s why we have been very focused and interested in the [real-world] application of stablecoins."

Listen to Part 1 of the podcast below, and keep a look out for Part 2 soon! 34,239 followers 🎙️ New podcast episode 🚀 4 impacts ofStraitsXin-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of fiat-backed stablecoins XSGD and XUSD

This week’s episode has returning guestTianwei Liu, Deputy CEO of Southeast Asia#fintechgroupFazz, the company behind digital asset infrastructure providerStraitsX. 

In 2023’sSingapore FinTech Festival, StraitsX received in-principle approval by the MAS for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD, opening up opportunities we cover in this first half of our call with the seasoned fintech#entrepreneur. 

1️⃣ For Fazz: building on five years of pioneering blockchain transactions to unlock more inter-currency corridors

🎙️ “It's almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD has been transacted on-chain...it gives us the confidence that this is going to be a regulated industry...and beyond the Singapore dollars...we are now able to issue G10 currency stablecoins out of Singapore with this new license regime and XUSD, which is what we're gonna be focusing our effort on in the coming years.”

2️⃣ For Singapore and ASEAN: More mainstream adoption with increased credibility and trust from regulators and institutions

🎙️ “It brings about the credibility that using this kind of medium to facilitate innovation in payment is the way that regulators around the world should be looking at this...It allows service providers like us and other players to be able to confidently say that what we are doing is regulated and we are doing this according to the standards needed both on the AML control side, as well on custody and the way that we safeguard the user's funds.”

3️⃣ For merchants and end-consumers: The same transactions, but faster, cheaper, and more interoperable thanks to blockchain technology (we cover the case of StraitsX collaborating with Grabpay and Alipay)

🎙️ “We can make this purpose-bound money the most purposeful and compliant by design...So the ML and compliance risk can be ring-fenced and properly controlled. Settlement will be instantaneous. Then the FX ability of the blockchain...can happen at a microtransaction level.”

4️⃣ For payments industry: Moving forward momentum of innovation (that comes in stages)

🎙️ “First, increase the acceptance and make sure that it's as seamless as possible without drop off rate. Then you go into costs. Can I make sure my cost is as low as possible, especially for cross border...Then the innovation, which is free game for a lot of guys to come in.”

👉 See the rest of the insights and the full podcast on Insignia Business Review:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9t👀 Or watch it on
Spotify:https://lnkd.in/gVbMjfSCApple Podcasts:https://lnkd.in/gyiryNiXYouTube:youtu.be/y-kEDB-ge_A📸 Photo from StraitsX

Today we share a timely story on the value of localizing frontier technologies like digital assets on a regulatory and compliance level

This isTianwei Liu, Group Deputy CEO ofFazz. (Photo taken from when we took our limited partners to visit the Singapore Fazz office for our Annual Summit)

Tianwei is an engineer who returned to Singapore from Silicon Valley, and in 2015 started a payments infrastructure company thanks in part to some cross-border Christmas gift experiences (he shares more in our podcast). Along the way, an initiative came about internally to develop Singapore’s first regulated stablecoin throughStraitsX. 

Fast forward to 2023, their work in maturing this stablecoin marked a new milestone in last week’sSingapore FinTech Festival.

In a speech (see link in the comments), theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)’s Managing Director Ravi Menon also announced that “MAS has granted in-principle approval under the Payment Services Act to three entities who will issue stable coins that substantively comply with MAS’ upcoming stablecoin regulatory framework…Once the legislative amendments take effect, these stable coins will be regarded as “MAS-regulated stablecoins”. These includeStraitsXSGD issuance that will house the XSGD pegged stablecoin already on the market, and StraitsX USD Issuance. 

This is a step forward in developing a truly sustainable digital currency. And through Project Orchid, well-regulated stable coins are already being trialled for use cases like purpose-bound money. For example, StraitsX enables XSGD-backed purpose-bound money to facilitate escrow arrangements in e-commerce transactions, ensuring that funds are released to merchants only when the customer receives the purchased items. It was also tested in the Festival, in partnership with Amazon and Grab.

This development comes full circle to what Tianwei shared on our podcast a year ago: 
“You’re going to have a world that is going to be nominated in US dollars, everything is US dollars-based, but day-to-day wise, do we ever see a US dollar and we will use it as the ultimate payment [method]? 

I don’t think that will ever happen. So we need to figure out how to make sure that there is a thriving decentralized finance ecosystem in the Asia Pacific. Be it Singaporean dollars, Indonesia rupiah, Philippine pesos or in Vietnamese dong, it has to be built out by the locals, and that will require us to be the pioneers. And actually working very closely with regulators to build out that ecosystem for ourselves.” 

Localization for startups is no longer just a matter of developing products for a specific market, but ensuring that the business is operationally compliant with local regulations. This presents an even greater competitive advantage for startups able to develop their compliance muscle. 

Kudos to Tianwei and the StraitsX team for this milestone!#digitalassets#sff2023#straitsx#fazz#IVPAnnualSummit2023

prompts_output.Prompt: Categorize these posts into different themes related to cryptocurrency (e.g., regulation, technological advancements, market predictions). Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts can be categorized into **Education Initiatives**, **Technological Advancements**, **Sustainability**, **Financial Support**, and **Market Expansion**. They cover blockchain education, green energy, low transaction costs, secure digital assets, and market growth, aligning with investor priorities and legitimate business strategies.

prompts_output.Prompt: Assess these posts for insights into investor behavior, concerns, and expectations regarding cryptocurrencies. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: Investors seek secure, sustainable digital assets with low transaction costs, emphasizing blockchain resilience, compliance, education, and green energy. They favor long-term growth and legitimate business practices, avoiding schemes like pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes.

prompts_output.Prompt: Spot any emerging trends in topics discussed in these posts about the company. Are there any new developments, controversies, or milestones that are garnering attention? Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: Emerging trends include blockchain education, green energy initiatives, and market expansion. New developments feature educational partnerships, Tether tokens on new platforms, and renewable energy mining sites. No significant controversies or milestones are highlighted.

prompts_output.Prompt: Identify any patterns or strategies in these posts that resemble known cryptocurrency manipulation tactics such as pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts focus on legitimate business strategies without evidence of artificial price inflation or unsustainable returns, typical of manipulation tactics like pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes. They exhibit bot-like characteristics but lack manipulation indicators.

prompts_output.Prompt: Analyze these posts to determine if any show characteristics of being generated by bots or automated accounts. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts exhibit bot-like characteristics such as lack of personal engagement, repetitive promotional language, and multiple links, but they focus on legitimate business strategies, making it inconclusive without more context.

prompts_output.Prompt: Examine these posts for the presence of invite links to cryptocurrency channels or groups, and assess their potential role in manipulation schemes. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts lack invite links to cryptocurrency channels or groups and focus on legitimate business strategies, indicating no involvement in manipulation schemes.

prompts_output.Prompt: Categorize these posts based on their content and topics, focusing on how they relate to cryptocurrency market trends and investor behavior. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts can be categorized into **Education Initiatives**, **Technological Advancements**, **Sustainability**, **Financial Support**, and **Market Expansion**. They highlight trends in blockchain education, green energy, low transaction costs, and secure digital assets, aligning with investor priorities and avoiding manipulation schemes.

overall_prompt_summary:
The posts exhibit characteristics of bot-generated content, such as lack of personal engagement, repetitive promotional language, and multiple links, but they focus on legitimate business strategies. This makes it inconclusive without more context to definitively determine their nature.

The most important issues are the lack of personal engagement and the repetitive promotional language, which are typical of bot-generated content. Additionally, the presence of multiple links further supports this observation. 

To improve, adding more personal engagement and reducing repetitive language could make the content appear more authentic.

profile_bio:
StraitsX is the pioneering payments infrastructure for the digital assets space in Southeast Asia. It is a Major Payment Institution licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore. 

StraitsX offers personal and business accounts to transfer and hold funds as well as to connect accounts to digital asset platforms. Business accounts can also access B2B API-enabled payments rails for digital asset platforms. 

StraitsX issues the Singapore Dollar-backed stablecoin, XSGD & Indonesian Rupiah-backed stablecoin.

StraitsX is a brand under Fazz, backed and supported by prominent investors including Tiger Global, Insignia Venture Partners, B Capital, BRI Ventures.

For more information, please visit straitsx.com.

🎙️ “...for compliance and fintech, talking to regulators, having an open dialogue, showing consistency and who's the person behind the company and what are you trying to achieve here...builds trust and credibility.”

2️⃣ A culture of customer-centric compliance is even more important to set the pace of product development, especially when developers are layers away from end-consumers. 

🎙️ “...“move fast and break things” does not apply here. In payments and fintech, you can't break things...You actually have to set the culture to do things right the first time and consider the impact on the customers and on people…”

3️⃣ Participate in regulatory sandboxes and make the most of regulatory openness to experimentation.

🎙️ “[They] allow you to basically do the smallest field experiments, to demonstrate certain things before getting to your bigger customers…”

4️⃣ Regulation opens doors to previously inaccessible market segments (e.g., FIs and banks) but the product makes the first step. 

🎙️ “Getting these licenses and compliance helps to give you a stamp of approval. It is not enough, but it's definitely more helpful to at least help education move along. It also means that institutions are able then to adopt this blockchain technology...you can then serve a wider customer that traditionally would either be fearful or unable to reach.”

5️⃣ Time and place matter when it comes to regulation. There are also regulatory blue oceans as well and this factors into the growth potential of the business. 

“Singapore is in a perfect position to do it, because of the regulation regime where you probably would think about China and other jurisdictions being geopolitically sensitive as well...potentially, this means for the whole entire region there will be a lot more adoption given that now Singapore has set the bar down.”

Tianwei Liu, CEO & Co-Founder of StraitsX, had this to say about our journey in unlocking blockchain-enabled payments when he recently sat down for the latest instalment of the 'On Call withInsignia Ventures Partners' podcast series: 

"It’s almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD transacted on-chain… It’s beyond our [expectations] initially how this has come along. A lot of us here are big believers.. and technology is at the heart of what we do. We’re trying to solve problems. And we see that blockchain solutions do have merit to address things that traditional centralised systems [otherwise] cannot do. And that’s why we have been very focused and interested in the [real-world] application of stablecoins."

Listen to Part 1 of the podcast below, and keep a look out for Part 2 soon! 34,259 followers 🎙️ New podcast episode 🚀 4 impacts ofStraitsXin-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of fiat-backed stablecoins XSGD and XUSD

This week’s episode has returning guestTianwei Liu, Deputy CEO of Southeast Asia#fintechgroupFazz, the company behind digital asset infrastructure providerStraitsX. 

In 2023’sSingapore FinTech Festival, StraitsX received in-principle approval by the MAS for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD, opening up opportunities we cover in this first half of our call with the seasoned fintech#entrepreneur. 

1️⃣ For Fazz: building on five years of pioneering blockchain transactions to unlock more inter-currency corridors

🎙️ “It's almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD has been transacted on-chain...it gives us the confidence that this is going to be a regulated industry...and beyond the Singapore dollars...we are now able to issue G10 currency stablecoins out of Singapore with this new license regime and XUSD, which is what we're gonna be focusing our effort on in the coming years.”

2️⃣ For Singapore and ASEAN: More mainstream adoption with increased credibility and trust from regulators and institutions

🎙️ “It brings about the credibility that using this kind of medium to facilitate innovation in payment is the way that regulators around the world should be looking at this...It allows service providers like us and other players to be able to confidently say that what we are doing is regulated and we are doing this according to the standards needed both on the AML control side, as well on custody and the way that we safeguard the user's funds.”

3️⃣ For merchants and end-consumers: The same transactions, but faster, cheaper, and more interoperable thanks to blockchain technology (we cover the case of StraitsX collaborating with Grabpay and Alipay)

🎙️ “We can make this purpose-bound money the most purposeful and compliant by design...So the ML and compliance risk can be ring-fenced and properly controlled. Settlement will be instantaneous. Then the FX ability of the blockchain...can happen at a microtransaction level.”

4️⃣ For payments industry: Moving forward momentum of innovation (that comes in stages)

🎙️ “First, increase the acceptance and make sure that it's as seamless as possible without drop off rate. Then you go into costs. Can I make sure my cost is as low as possible, especially for cross border...Then the innovation, which is free game for a lot of guys to come in.”

Today we share a timely story on the value of localizing frontier technologies like digital assets on a regulatory and compliance level

This isTianwei Liu, Group Deputy CEO ofFazz. (Photo taken from when we took our limited partners to visit the Singapore Fazz office for our Annual Summit)

Tianwei is an engineer who returned to Singapore from Silicon Valley, and in 2015 started a payments infrastructure company thanks in part to some cross-border Christmas gift experiences (he shares more in our podcast). Along the way, an initiative came about internally to develop Singapore’s first regulated stablecoin throughStraitsX. 

Fast forward to 2023, their work in maturing this stablecoin marked a new milestone in last week’sSingapore FinTech Festival.

In a speech (see link in the comments), theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)’s Managing Director Ravi Menon also announced that “MAS has granted in-principle approval under the Payment Services Act to three entities who will issue stable coins that substantively comply with MAS’ upcoming stablecoin regulatory framework…Once the legislative amendments take effect, these stable coins will be regarded as “MAS-regulated stablecoins”. These includeStraitsXSGD issuance that will house the XSGD pegged stablecoin already on the market, and StraitsX USD Issuance. 

This is a step forward in developing a truly sustainable digital currency. And through Project Orchid, well-regulated stable coins are already being trialled for use cases like purpose-bound money. For example, StraitsX enables XSGD-backed purpose-bound money to facilitate escrow arrangements in e-commerce transactions, ensuring that funds are released to merchants only when the customer receives the purchased items. It was also tested in the Festival, in partnership with Amazon and Grab.

This development comes full circle to what Tianwei shared on our podcast a year ago: 
“You’re going to have a world that is going to be nominated in US dollars, everything is US dollars-based, but day-to-day wise, do we ever see a US dollar and we will use it as the ultimate payment [method]? 

I don’t think that will ever happen. So we need to figure out how to make sure that there is a thriving decentralized finance ecosystem in the Asia Pacific. Be it Singaporean dollars, Indonesia rupiah, Philippine pesos or in Vietnamese dong, it has to be built out by the locals, and that will require us to be the pioneers. And actually working very closely with regulators to build out that ecosystem for ourselves.” 

Localization for startups is no longer just a matter of developing products for a specific market, but ensuring that the business is operationally compliant with local regulations. This presents an even greater competitive advantage for startups able to develop their compliance muscle. 

Kudos to Tianwei and the StraitsX team for this milestone!#digitalassets#sff2023#straitsx#fazz#IVPAnnualSummit2023

overall_prompt_summary:

profile_bio:
StraitsX is the pioneering payments infrastructure for the digital assets space in Southeast Asia. It is a Major Payment Institution licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore. 

StraitsX offers personal and business accounts to transfer and hold funds as well as to connect accounts to digital asset platforms. Business accounts can also access B2B API-enabled payments rails for digital asset platforms. 

StraitsX issues the Singapore Dollar-backed stablecoin, XSGD & Indonesian Rupiah-backed stablecoin.

StraitsX is a brand under Fazz, backed and supported by prominent investors including Tiger Global, Insignia Venture Partners, B Capital, BRI Ventures.

For more information, please visit straitsx.com.

🌟 We were deeply honoured to welcome Minister of StateAlvin Tanto theStraitsXoffice last week! 🙇

🎙ICYMI: Our CEO and Co-Founder,Tianwei Liusat down withInsignia Ventures Partnersfor a two-part podcast; sharing insights and personal learnings from developing regulatory and compliance maturity across seven years of pioneering#fintechinfrastructure solutions out of Singapore and more than ten years of#entrepreneurship.

🎧 Catch up on both parts today:
Part 1:https://lnkd.in/gp8Af8GMPart 2:https://lnkd.in/gpSCRh5f 34,267 followers 🎙️ Part 2 of this week's#podcastwithFazzDeputy CEOTianwei Liu🚀 5#Regulationand#compliancelearnings from 10+ years pioneering#fintechsolutions out of#Singapore🇸🇬

InSingapore FinTech Festival2023, Fazz's digital asset infrastructure business StraitsX received in-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD stablecoins, opening up opportunities we covered in part 1:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9tPart 2 goes into learnings developing regulatory and compliance maturity from 7+ years pioneering fintech infrastructure solutions out of Singapore 

1️⃣ Continuous dialogue is key. 

🎙️ “...for compliance and fintech, talking to regulators, having an open dialogue, showing consistency and who's the person behind the company and what are you trying to achieve here...builds trust and credibility.”

2️⃣ A culture of customer-centric compliance is even more important to set the pace of product development, especially when developers are layers away from end-consumers. 

🎙️ “...“move fast and break things” does not apply here. In payments and fintech, you can't break things...You actually have to set the culture to do things right the first time and consider the impact on the customers and on people…”

3️⃣ Participate in regulatory sandboxes and make the most of regulatory openness to experimentation.

🎙️ “[They] allow you to basically do the smallest field experiments, to demonstrate certain things before getting to your bigger customers…”

4️⃣ Regulation opens doors to previously inaccessible market segments (e.g., FIs and banks) but the product makes the first step. 

🎙️ “Getting these licenses and compliance helps to give you a stamp of approval. It is not enough, but it's definitely more helpful to at least help education move along. It also means that institutions are able then to adopt this blockchain technology...you can then serve a wider customer that traditionally would either be fearful or unable to reach.”

5️⃣ Time and place matter when it comes to regulation. There are also regulatory blue oceans as well and this factors into the growth potential of the business. 

“Singapore is in a perfect position to do it, because of the regulation regime where you probably would think about China and other jurisdictions being geopolitically sensitive as well...potentially, this means for the whole entire region there will be a lot more adoption given that now Singapore has set the bar down.”

Tianwei Liu, CEO & Co-Founder of StraitsX, had this to say about our journey in unlocking blockchain-enabled payments when he recently sat down for the latest instalment of the 'On Call withInsignia Ventures Partners' podcast series: 

"It’s almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD transacted on-chain… It’s beyond our [expectations] initially how this has come along. A lot of us here are big believers.. and technology is at the heart of what we do. We’re trying to solve problems. And we see that blockchain solutions do have merit to address things that traditional centralised systems [otherwise] cannot do. And that’s why we have been very focused and interested in the [real-world] application of stablecoins."

Listen to Part 1 of the podcast below, and keep a look out for Part 2 soon! 34,267 followers 🎙️ New podcast episode 🚀 4 impacts ofStraitsXin-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of fiat-backed stablecoins XSGD and XUSD

This week’s episode has returning guestTianwei Liu, Deputy CEO of Southeast Asia#fintechgroupFazz, the company behind digital asset infrastructure providerStraitsX. 

In 2023’sSingapore FinTech Festival, StraitsX received in-principle approval by the MAS for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD, opening up opportunities we cover in this first half of our call with the seasoned fintech#entrepreneur. 

1️⃣ For Fazz: building on five years of pioneering blockchain transactions to unlock more inter-currency corridors

🎙️ “It's almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD has been transacted on-chain...it gives us the confidence that this is going to be a regulated industry...and beyond the Singapore dollars...we are now able to issue G10 currency stablecoins out of Singapore with this new license regime and XUSD, which is what we're gonna be focusing our effort on in the coming years.”

2️⃣ For Singapore and ASEAN: More mainstream adoption with increased credibility and trust from regulators and institutions

🎙️ “It brings about the credibility that using this kind of medium to facilitate innovation in payment is the way that regulators around the world should be looking at this...It allows service providers like us and other players to be able to confidently say that what we are doing is regulated and we are doing this according to the standards needed both on the AML control side, as well on custody and the way that we safeguard the user's funds.”

3️⃣ For merchants and end-consumers: The same transactions, but faster, cheaper, and more interoperable thanks to blockchain technology (we cover the case of StraitsX collaborating with Grabpay and Alipay)

🎙️ “We can make this purpose-bound money the most purposeful and compliant by design...So the ML and compliance risk can be ring-fenced and properly controlled. Settlement will be instantaneous. Then the FX ability of the blockchain...can happen at a microtransaction level.”

4️⃣ For payments industry: Moving forward momentum of innovation (that comes in stages)

🎙️ “First, increase the acceptance and make sure that it's as seamless as possible without drop off rate. Then you go into costs. Can I make sure my cost is as low as possible, especially for cross border...Then the innovation, which is free game for a lot of guys to come in.”

Today we share a timely story on the value of localizing frontier technologies like digital assets on a regulatory and compliance level

This isTianwei Liu, Group Deputy CEO ofFazz. (Photo taken from when we took our limited partners to visit the Singapore Fazz office for our Annual Summit)

Tianwei is an engineer who returned to Singapore from Silicon Valley, and in 2015 started a payments infrastructure company thanks in part to some cross-border Christmas gift experiences (he shares more in our podcast). Along the way, an initiative came about internally to develop Singapore’s first regulated stablecoin throughStraitsX. 

Fast forward to 2023, their work in maturing this stablecoin marked a new milestone in last week’sSingapore FinTech Festival.

In a speech (see link in the comments), theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)’s Managing Director Ravi Menon also announced that “MAS has granted in-principle approval under the Payment Services Act to three entities who will issue stable coins that substantively comply with MAS’ upcoming stablecoin regulatory framework…Once the legislative amendments take effect, these stable coins will be regarded as “MAS-regulated stablecoins”. These includeStraitsXSGD issuance that will house the XSGD pegged stablecoin already on the market, and StraitsX USD Issuance. 

This is a step forward in developing a truly sustainable digital currency. And through Project Orchid, well-regulated stable coins are already being trialled for use cases like purpose-bound money. For example, StraitsX enables XSGD-backed purpose-bound money to facilitate escrow arrangements in e-commerce transactions, ensuring that funds are released to merchants only when the customer receives the purchased items. It was also tested in the Festival, in partnership with Amazon and Grab.

This development comes full circle to what Tianwei shared on our podcast a year ago: 
“You’re going to have a world that is going to be nominated in US dollars, everything is US dollars-based, but day-to-day wise, do we ever see a US dollar and we will use it as the ultimate payment [method]? 

I don’t think that will ever happen. So we need to figure out how to make sure that there is a thriving decentralized finance ecosystem in the Asia Pacific. Be it Singaporean dollars, Indonesia rupiah, Philippine pesos or in Vietnamese dong, it has to be built out by the locals, and that will require us to be the pioneers. And actually working very closely with regulators to build out that ecosystem for ourselves.” 

Localization for startups is no longer just a matter of developing products for a specific market, but ensuring that the business is operationally compliant with local regulations. This presents an even greater competitive advantage for startups able to develop their compliance muscle. 

Kudos to Tianwei and the StraitsX team for this milestone!#digitalassets#sff2023#straitsx#fazz#IVPAnnualSummit2023

prompts_output.Prompt: Categorize these posts into different themes related to cryptocurrency (e.g., regulation, technological advancements, market predictions). Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts can be categorized into **Regulation**, **Technological Advancements**, **Education**, **Sustainability**, and **Market Trends**. They emphasize stability, regulatory compliance, green energy, and innovation, aligning with investor preferences for sustainable and secure investments in the cryptocurrency space.

prompts_output.Prompt: Assess these posts for insights into investor behavior, concerns, and expectations regarding cryptocurrencies. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: Investors prioritize stability, regulatory compliance, and sustainability in cryptocurrencies, favoring educational initiatives and technological advancements while avoiding aggressive promotions and unrealistic profit promises, reflecting a preference for reliable and transparent market practices.

prompts_output.Prompt: Spot any emerging trends in topics discussed in these posts about the company. Are there any new developments, controversies, or milestones that are garnering attention? Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: Emerging trends include regulatory compliance, green energy in mining, and educational initiatives, focusing on stability, sustainability, and technological advancements. No new controversies or aggressive price promotions are evident.

prompts_output.Prompt: Identify any patterns or strategies in these posts that resemble known cryptocurrency manipulation tactics such as pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts lack patterns of cryptocurrency manipulation tactics like pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes, instead focusing on stability, regulatory compliance, and technological development without aggressive price promotion or unrealistic profit promises.

prompts_output.Prompt: Analyze these posts to determine if any show characteristics of being generated by bots or automated accounts. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts exhibit a promotional tone, repetitive calls to action, and lack personal engagement or context-specific details, all of which suggest they could be generated by bots or automated accounts.

prompts_output.Prompt: Examine these posts for the presence of invite links to cryptocurrency channels or groups, and assess their potential role in manipulation schemes. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts lack invite links to cryptocurrency channels or groups and focus on Tether's collaborations, compliance, and educational initiatives, showing no signs of manipulation schemes like aggressive price promotion or unrealistic profit promises.

prompts_output.Prompt: Categorize these posts based on their content and topics, focusing on how they relate to cryptocurrency market trends and investor behavior. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts fall under **Market Trends** as they emphasize stability, regulatory compliance, green energy, and innovation, reflecting investor preferences for sustainable and secure investments in the cryptocurrency space.

overall_prompt_summary:
The posts emphasize stability, regulatory alignment, and technological development, avoiding aggressive price promotion or unrealistic profit promises typical of manipulation schemes. They focus on partnerships, compliance, and education, suggesting a legitimate approach.

However, the posts exhibit a promotional tone, repetitive calls to action, and lack personal engagement or context-specific details, indicating they could be generated by bots or automated accounts. The absence of invite links to cryptocurrency channels or groups further supports the notion that these posts are not part of a pump-and-dump or Ponzi scheme.

To improve, the posts could incorporate more personal engagement and context-specific details to enhance authenticity and user trust.

profile_bio:
StraitsX is the pioneering payments infrastructure for the digital assets space in Southeast Asia. It is a Major Payment Institution licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore. 

StraitsX offers personal and business accounts to transfer and hold funds as well as to connect accounts to digital asset platforms. Business accounts can also access B2B API-enabled payments rails for digital asset platforms. 

StraitsX issues the Singapore Dollar-backed stablecoin, XSGD & Indonesian Rupiah-backed stablecoin.

StraitsX is a brand under Fazz, backed and supported by prominent investors including Tiger Global, Insignia Venture Partners, B Capital, BRI Ventures.

For more information, please visit straitsx.com.

🎙ICYMI: Our CEO and Co-Founder,Tianwei Liusat down withInsignia Ventures Partnersfor a two-part podcast; sharing insights and personal learnings from developing regulatory and compliance maturity across seven years of pioneering#fintechinfrastructure solutions out of Singapore and more than ten years of#entrepreneurship.

🎧 Catch up on both parts today:
Part 1:https://lnkd.in/gp8Af8GMPart 2:https://lnkd.in/gpSCRh5f 34,285 followers 🎙️ Part 2 of this week's#podcastwithFazzDeputy CEOTianwei Liu🚀 5#Regulationand#compliancelearnings from 10+ years pioneering#fintechsolutions out of#Singapore🇸🇬

InSingapore FinTech Festival2023, Fazz's digital asset infrastructure business StraitsX received in-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD stablecoins, opening up opportunities we covered in part 1:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9tPart 2 goes into learnings developing regulatory and compliance maturity from 7+ years pioneering fintech infrastructure solutions out of Singapore 

1️⃣ Continuous dialogue is key. 

🎙️ “...for compliance and fintech, talking to regulators, having an open dialogue, showing consistency and who's the person behind the company and what are you trying to achieve here...builds trust and credibility.”

2️⃣ A culture of customer-centric compliance is even more important to set the pace of product development, especially when developers are layers away from end-consumers. 

🎙️ “...“move fast and break things” does not apply here. In payments and fintech, you can't break things...You actually have to set the culture to do things right the first time and consider the impact on the customers and on people…”

3️⃣ Participate in regulatory sandboxes and make the most of regulatory openness to experimentation.

🎙️ “[They] allow you to basically do the smallest field experiments, to demonstrate certain things before getting to your bigger customers…”

4️⃣ Regulation opens doors to previously inaccessible market segments (e.g., FIs and banks) but the product makes the first step. 

🎙️ “Getting these licenses and compliance helps to give you a stamp of approval. It is not enough, but it's definitely more helpful to at least help education move along. It also means that institutions are able then to adopt this blockchain technology...you can then serve a wider customer that traditionally would either be fearful or unable to reach.”

5️⃣ Time and place matter when it comes to regulation. There are also regulatory blue oceans as well and this factors into the growth potential of the business. 

“Singapore is in a perfect position to do it, because of the regulation regime where you probably would think about China and other jurisdictions being geopolitically sensitive as well...potentially, this means for the whole entire region there will be a lot more adoption given that now Singapore has set the bar down.”

👉 See the rest of the insights:https://lnkd.in/gKcWyCYV👀 Or watch it on
Spotify:https://lnkd.in/g6D3_Z5vApple Podcasts:https://lnkd.in/gg36bWHNYouTube:https://lnkd.in/gKZ2aXRT

Tianwei Liu, CEO & Co-Founder of StraitsX, had this to say about our journey in unlocking blockchain-enabled payments when he recently sat down for the latest instalment of the 'On Call withInsignia Ventures Partners' podcast series: 

"It’s almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD transacted on-chain… It’s beyond our [expectations] initially how this has come along. A lot of us here are big believers.. and technology is at the heart of what we do. We’re trying to solve problems. And we see that blockchain solutions do have merit to address things that traditional centralised systems [otherwise] cannot do. And that’s why we have been very focused and interested in the [real-world] application of stablecoins."

Listen to Part 1 of the podcast below, and keep a look out for Part 2 soon! 34,285 followers 🎙️ New podcast episode 🚀 4 impacts ofStraitsXin-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of fiat-backed stablecoins XSGD and XUSD

This week’s episode has returning guestTianwei Liu, Deputy CEO of Southeast Asia#fintechgroupFazz, the company behind digital asset infrastructure providerStraitsX. 

In 2023’sSingapore FinTech Festival, StraitsX received in-principle approval by the MAS for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD, opening up opportunities we cover in this first half of our call with the seasoned fintech#entrepreneur. 

1️⃣ For Fazz: building on five years of pioneering blockchain transactions to unlock more inter-currency corridors

🎙️ “It's almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD has been transacted on-chain...it gives us the confidence that this is going to be a regulated industry...and beyond the Singapore dollars...we are now able to issue G10 currency stablecoins out of Singapore with this new license regime and XUSD, which is what we're gonna be focusing our effort on in the coming years.”

2️⃣ For Singapore and ASEAN: More mainstream adoption with increased credibility and trust from regulators and institutions

🎙️ “It brings about the credibility that using this kind of medium to facilitate innovation in payment is the way that regulators around the world should be looking at this...It allows service providers like us and other players to be able to confidently say that what we are doing is regulated and we are doing this according to the standards needed both on the AML control side, as well on custody and the way that we safeguard the user's funds.”

3️⃣ For merchants and end-consumers: The same transactions, but faster, cheaper, and more interoperable thanks to blockchain technology (we cover the case of StraitsX collaborating with Grabpay and Alipay)

🎙️ “We can make this purpose-bound money the most purposeful and compliant by design...So the ML and compliance risk can be ring-fenced and properly controlled. Settlement will be instantaneous. Then the FX ability of the blockchain...can happen at a microtransaction level.”

4️⃣ For payments industry: Moving forward momentum of innovation (that comes in stages)

🎙️ “First, increase the acceptance and make sure that it's as seamless as possible without drop off rate. Then you go into costs. Can I make sure my cost is as low as possible, especially for cross border...Then the innovation, which is free game for a lot of guys to come in.”

👉 See the rest of the insights and the full podcast on Insignia Business Review:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9t👀 Or watch it on
Spotify:https://lnkd.in/gVbMjfSCApple Podcasts:https://lnkd.in/gyiryNiXYouTube:youtu.be/y-kEDB-ge_A📸 Photo from StraitsX

Today we share a timely story on the value of localizing frontier technologies like digital assets on a regulatory and compliance level

This isTianwei Liu, Group Deputy CEO ofFazz. (Photo taken from when we took our limited partners to visit the Singapore Fazz office for our Annual Summit)

Tianwei is an engineer who returned to Singapore from Silicon Valley, and in 2015 started a payments infrastructure company thanks in part to some cross-border Christmas gift experiences (he shares more in our podcast). Along the way, an initiative came about internally to develop Singapore’s first regulated stablecoin throughStraitsX. 

Fast forward to 2023, their work in maturing this stablecoin marked a new milestone in last week’sSingapore FinTech Festival.

In a speech (see link in the comments), theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)’s Managing Director Ravi Menon also announced that “MAS has granted in-principle approval under the Payment Services Act to three entities who will issue stable coins that substantively comply with MAS’ upcoming stablecoin regulatory framework…Once the legislative amendments take effect, these stable coins will be regarded as “MAS-regulated stablecoins”. These includeStraitsXSGD issuance that will house the XSGD pegged stablecoin already on the market, and StraitsX USD Issuance. 

This is a step forward in developing a truly sustainable digital currency. And through Project Orchid, well-regulated stable coins are already being trialled for use cases like purpose-bound money. For example, StraitsX enables XSGD-backed purpose-bound money to facilitate escrow arrangements in e-commerce transactions, ensuring that funds are released to merchants only when the customer receives the purchased items. It was also tested in the Festival, in partnership with Amazon and Grab.

This development comes full circle to what Tianwei shared on our podcast a year ago: 
“You’re going to have a world that is going to be nominated in US dollars, everything is US dollars-based, but day-to-day wise, do we ever see a US dollar and we will use it as the ultimate payment [method]? 

I don’t think that will ever happen. So we need to figure out how to make sure that there is a thriving decentralized finance ecosystem in the Asia Pacific. Be it Singaporean dollars, Indonesia rupiah, Philippine pesos or in Vietnamese dong, it has to be built out by the locals, and that will require us to be the pioneers. And actually working very closely with regulators to build out that ecosystem for ourselves.” 

Localization for startups is no longer just a matter of developing products for a specific market, but ensuring that the business is operationally compliant with local regulations. This presents an even greater competitive advantage for startups able to develop their compliance muscle. 

Kudos to Tianwei and the StraitsX team for this milestone!#digitalassets#sff2023#straitsx#fazz#IVPAnnualSummit2023

prompts_output.Prompt: Categorize these posts into different themes related to cryptocurrency (e.g., regulation, technological advancements, market predictions). Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts can be categorized into **Adoption and Integration**, **Financial Performance**, and **Emerging Trends**. They focus on Tether's platform expansions, financial transparency, and technological advancements, aligning with investor interests in blockchain resilience, compliance, and innovation within broader cryptocurrency market trends.

prompts_output.Prompt: Assess these posts for insights into investor behavior, concerns, and expectations regarding cryptocurrencies. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: Investors prioritize blockchain resilience, renewable energy, and education, valuing compliance and stablecoin utility. They are concerned about security and transaction costs, while expecting innovation and broader digital asset adoption. Posts emphasize legitimacy through partnerships and advancements, avoiding manipulative schemes.

prompts_output.Prompt: Spot any emerging trends in topics discussed in these posts about the company. Are there any new developments, controversies, or milestones that are garnering attention? Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: Emerging trends include Tether's platform expansions, enhanced financial transparency, and technological advancements, reflecting a focus on blockchain resilience, compliance, and innovation, aligning with broader cryptocurrency market trends and investor interests. No new controversies or major milestones are highlighted.

prompts_output.Prompt: Identify any patterns or strategies in these posts that resemble known cryptocurrency manipulation tactics such as pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts lack patterns typical of manipulation tactics like pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes, focusing instead on partnerships, technological advancements, and educational initiatives without misleading hype or high return promises.

prompts_output.Prompt: Analyze these posts to determine if any show characteristics of being generated by bots or automated accounts. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts exhibit a promotional tone, lack personal engagement, and include multiple links—traits often linked to bot-generated content. However, without additional context, it's not definitive.

prompts_output.Prompt: Examine these posts for the presence of invite links to cryptocurrency channels or groups, and assess their potential role in manipulation schemes. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts lack invite links to cryptocurrency channels or groups and primarily share informational updates on Tether's activities, showing no evident elements of manipulation schemes.

prompts_output.Prompt: Categorize these posts based on their content and topics, focusing on how they relate to cryptocurrency market trends and investor behavior. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts fall into **Adoption and Integration**, **Financial Performance**, and **Emerging Trends**, highlighting Tether's platform expansions, financial transparency, and technological advancements, reflecting investor interests in blockchain resilience, compliance, and innovation within broader cryptocurrency market trends.

overall_prompt_summary:
The posts focus on promoting partnerships, technological advancements, and educational initiatives, and do not exhibit patterns typical of pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes. They have a promotional tone, lack personal engagement, and include multiple links, which are traits often associated with bot-generated content.

The most important issues are the absence of personal engagement and the presence of multiple links, which can make the content seem impersonal and automated. Additionally, the promotional tone might reduce the perceived authenticity of the posts.

To improve, incorporating more personal engagement and reducing the number of links could make the content appear more genuine and relatable.

profile_bio:
StraitsX is the pioneering payments infrastructure for the digital assets space in Southeast Asia. It is a Major Payment Institution licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore. 

StraitsX offers personal and business accounts to transfer and hold funds as well as to connect accounts to digital asset platforms. Business accounts can also access B2B API-enabled payments rails for digital asset platforms. 

StraitsX issues the Singapore Dollar-backed stablecoin, XSGD & Indonesian Rupiah-backed stablecoin.

StraitsX is a brand under Fazz, backed and supported by prominent investors including Tiger Global, Insignia Venture Partners, B Capital, BRI Ventures.

For more information, please visit straitsx.com.
