🎙ICYMI: Our CEO and Co-Founder,Tianwei Liusat down withInsignia Ventures Partnersfor a two-part podcast; sharing insights and personal learnings from developing regulatory and compliance maturity across seven years of pioneering#fintechinfrastructure solutions out of Singapore and more than ten years of#entrepreneurship.

🎧 Catch up on both parts today:
Part 1:https://lnkd.in/gp8Af8GMPart 2:https://lnkd.in/gpSCRh5f 34,295 followers 🎙️ Part 2 of this week's#podcastwithFazzDeputy CEOTianwei Liu🚀 5#Regulationand#compliancelearnings from 10+ years pioneering#fintechsolutions out of#Singapore🇸🇬

InSingapore FinTech Festival2023, Fazz's digital asset infrastructure business StraitsX received in-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD stablecoins, opening up opportunities we covered in part 1:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9tPart 2 goes into learnings developing regulatory and compliance maturity from 7+ years pioneering fintech infrastructure solutions out of Singapore 

1️⃣ Continuous dialogue is key. 

🎙️ “...for compliance and fintech, talking to regulators, having an open dialogue, showing consistency and who's the person behind the company and what are you trying to achieve here...builds trust and credibility.”

2️⃣ A culture of customer-centric compliance is even more important to set the pace of product development, especially when developers are layers away from end-consumers. 

🎙️ “...“move fast and break things” does not apply here. In payments and fintech, you can't break things...You actually have to set the culture to do things right the first time and consider the impact on the customers and on people…”

3️⃣ Participate in regulatory sandboxes and make the most of regulatory openness to experimentation.

🎙️ “[They] allow you to basically do the smallest field experiments, to demonstrate certain things before getting to your bigger customers…”

4️⃣ Regulation opens doors to previously inaccessible market segments (e.g., FIs and banks) but the product makes the first step. 

🎙️ “Getting these licenses and compliance helps to give you a stamp of approval. It is not enough, but it's definitely more helpful to at least help education move along. It also means that institutions are able then to adopt this blockchain technology...you can then serve a wider customer that traditionally would either be fearful or unable to reach.”

5️⃣ Time and place matter when it comes to regulation. There are also regulatory blue oceans as well and this factors into the growth potential of the business. 

“Singapore is in a perfect position to do it, because of the regulation regime where you probably would think about China and other jurisdictions being geopolitically sensitive as well...potentially, this means for the whole entire region there will be a lot more adoption given that now Singapore has set the bar down.”

Tianwei Liu, CEO & Co-Founder of StraitsX, had this to say about our journey in unlocking blockchain-enabled payments when he recently sat down for the latest instalment of the 'On Call withInsignia Ventures Partners' podcast series: 

"It’s almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD transacted on-chain… It’s beyond our [expectations] initially how this has come along. A lot of us here are big believers.. and technology is at the heart of what we do. We’re trying to solve problems. And we see that blockchain solutions do have merit to address things that traditional centralised systems [otherwise] cannot do. And that’s why we have been very focused and interested in the [real-world] application of stablecoins."

Listen to Part 1 of the podcast below, and keep a look out for Part 2 soon! 34,295 followers 🎙️ New podcast episode 🚀 4 impacts ofStraitsXin-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of fiat-backed stablecoins XSGD and XUSD

This week’s episode has returning guestTianwei Liu, Deputy CEO of Southeast Asia#fintechgroupFazz, the company behind digital asset infrastructure providerStraitsX. 

In 2023’sSingapore FinTech Festival, StraitsX received in-principle approval by the MAS for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD, opening up opportunities we cover in this first half of our call with the seasoned fintech#entrepreneur. 

1️⃣ For Fazz: building on five years of pioneering blockchain transactions to unlock more inter-currency corridors

🎙️ “It's almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD has been transacted on-chain...it gives us the confidence that this is going to be a regulated industry...and beyond the Singapore dollars...we are now able to issue G10 currency stablecoins out of Singapore with this new license regime and XUSD, which is what we're gonna be focusing our effort on in the coming years.”

2️⃣ For Singapore and ASEAN: More mainstream adoption with increased credibility and trust from regulators and institutions

🎙️ “It brings about the credibility that using this kind of medium to facilitate innovation in payment is the way that regulators around the world should be looking at this...It allows service providers like us and other players to be able to confidently say that what we are doing is regulated and we are doing this according to the standards needed both on the AML control side, as well on custody and the way that we safeguard the user's funds.”

3️⃣ For merchants and end-consumers: The same transactions, but faster, cheaper, and more interoperable thanks to blockchain technology (we cover the case of StraitsX collaborating with Grabpay and Alipay)

🎙️ “We can make this purpose-bound money the most purposeful and compliant by design...So the ML and compliance risk can be ring-fenced and properly controlled. Settlement will be instantaneous. Then the FX ability of the blockchain...can happen at a microtransaction level.”

4️⃣ For payments industry: Moving forward momentum of innovation (that comes in stages)

🎙️ “First, increase the acceptance and make sure that it's as seamless as possible without drop off rate. Then you go into costs. Can I make sure my cost is as low as possible, especially for cross border...Then the innovation, which is free game for a lot of guys to come in.”

👉 See the rest of the insights and the full podcast on Insignia Business Review:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9t👀 Or watch it on
Spotify:https://lnkd.in/gVbMjfSCApple Podcasts:https://lnkd.in/gyiryNiXYouTube:youtu.be/y-kEDB-ge_A📸 Photo from StraitsX

Today we share a timely story on the value of localizing frontier technologies like digital assets on a regulatory and compliance level

This isTianwei Liu, Group Deputy CEO ofFazz. (Photo taken from when we took our limited partners to visit the Singapore Fazz office for our Annual Summit)

Tianwei is an engineer who returned to Singapore from Silicon Valley, and in 2015 started a payments infrastructure company thanks in part to some cross-border Christmas gift experiences (he shares more in our podcast). Along the way, an initiative came about internally to develop Singapore’s first regulated stablecoin throughStraitsX. 

Fast forward to 2023, their work in maturing this stablecoin marked a new milestone in last week’sSingapore FinTech Festival.

In a speech (see link in the comments), theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)’s Managing Director Ravi Menon also announced that “MAS has granted in-principle approval under the Payment Services Act to three entities who will issue stable coins that substantively comply with MAS’ upcoming stablecoin regulatory framework…Once the legislative amendments take effect, these stable coins will be regarded as “MAS-regulated stablecoins”. These includeStraitsXSGD issuance that will house the XSGD pegged stablecoin already on the market, and StraitsX USD Issuance. 

This is a step forward in developing a truly sustainable digital currency. And through Project Orchid, well-regulated stable coins are already being trialled for use cases like purpose-bound money. For example, StraitsX enables XSGD-backed purpose-bound money to facilitate escrow arrangements in e-commerce transactions, ensuring that funds are released to merchants only when the customer receives the purchased items. It was also tested in the Festival, in partnership with Amazon and Grab.

This development comes full circle to what Tianwei shared on our podcast a year ago: 
“You’re going to have a world that is going to be nominated in US dollars, everything is US dollars-based, but day-to-day wise, do we ever see a US dollar and we will use it as the ultimate payment [method]? 

I don’t think that will ever happen. So we need to figure out how to make sure that there is a thriving decentralized finance ecosystem in the Asia Pacific. Be it Singaporean dollars, Indonesia rupiah, Philippine pesos or in Vietnamese dong, it has to be built out by the locals, and that will require us to be the pioneers. And actually working very closely with regulators to build out that ecosystem for ourselves.” 

Localization for startups is no longer just a matter of developing products for a specific market, but ensuring that the business is operationally compliant with local regulations. This presents an even greater competitive advantage for startups able to develop their compliance muscle. 

Kudos to Tianwei and the StraitsX team for this milestone!#digitalassets#sff2023#straitsx#fazz#IVPAnnualSummit2023

prompts_output.Prompt: Categorize these posts into different themes related to cryptocurrency (e.g., regulation, technological advancements, market predictions). Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts can be categorized into **Technological Advancements**, **Market Expansion**, **Regulation and Compliance**, and **Partnerships and Collaborations**. These themes reflect investor interests in blockchain resilience, sustainable mining, financial inclusion, and compliance, driving cryptocurrency adoption and trust.

prompts_output.Prompt: Assess these posts for insights into investor behavior, concerns, and expectations regarding cryptocurrencies. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: Investors prioritize blockchain resilience, renewable energy in mining, financial inclusion, and compliance. They expect robust security, sustainable practices, and educational initiatives to drive cryptocurrency adoption and trust, focusing on technological advancements, market expansion, regulation, and partnerships.

prompts_output.Prompt: Spot any emerging trends in topics discussed in these posts about the company. Are there any new developments, controversies, or milestones that are garnering attention? Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: Emerging trends include USD₮ on TON, green energy mining, market expansion, and regulation focus. Notable milestones are collaborations and investments, with no controversies noted, emphasizing transparency and sustainability.

prompts_output.Prompt: Identify any patterns or strategies in these posts that resemble known cryptocurrency manipulation tactics such as pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts lack patterns typical of manipulation tactics like pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes, focusing instead on transparency, compliance, and legitimate partnerships without misleading elements or invite links.

prompts_output.Prompt: Analyze these posts to determine if any show characteristics of being generated by bots or automated accounts. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts exhibit bot-like characteristics due to their lack of personal engagement, repetitive promotional content, and multiple links, while focusing on partnerships, platform integrations, and compliance without including invite links to cryptocurrency channels or groups.

prompts_output.Prompt: Examine these posts for the presence of invite links to cryptocurrency channels or groups, and assess their potential role in manipulation schemes. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts lack invite links to cryptocurrency channels or groups, focusing instead on partnerships, platform integrations, and compliance, suggesting they aim for genuine engagement rather than participating in manipulation schemes.

prompts_output.Prompt: Categorize these posts based on their content and topics, focusing on how they relate to cryptocurrency market trends and investor behavior. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts can be categorized into **Technological Advancements**, **Market Expansion**, **Regulation and Compliance**, and **Partnerships and Collaborations**. These categories reflect investor interests in blockchain resilience, sustainable mining, financial inclusion, and compliance, driving cryptocurrency adoption and trust.

overall_prompt_summary:
The posts emphasize transparency, compliance, and legitimate partnerships, avoiding manipulation tactics like pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes. They focus on positive news, technological advancements, and market expansion, often lacking personal engagement and featuring repetitive promotional content.

The most important issues include the lack of personal engagement and the presence of repetitive content, which suggest bot-generated or automated accounts. Additionally, the posts include multiple links, further indicating automation.

A potential improvement would be to increase personal engagement and reduce repetitive content to make the posts appear more authentic and engaging.

profile_bio:
StraitsX is the pioneering payments infrastructure for the digital assets space in Southeast Asia. It is a Major Payment Institution licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore. 

StraitsX offers personal and business accounts to transfer and hold funds as well as to connect accounts to digital asset platforms. Business accounts can also access B2B API-enabled payments rails for digital asset platforms. 

StraitsX issues the Singapore Dollar-backed stablecoin, XSGD & Indonesian Rupiah-backed stablecoin.

StraitsX is a brand under Fazz, backed and supported by prominent investors including Tiger Global, Insignia Venture Partners, B Capital, BRI Ventures.

For more information, please visit straitsx.com.

🎙ICYMI: Our CEO and Co-Founder,Tianwei Liusat down withInsignia Ventures Partnersfor a two-part podcast; sharing insights and personal learnings from developing regulatory and compliance maturity across seven years of pioneering#fintechinfrastructure solutions out of Singapore and more than ten years of#entrepreneurship.

🎧 Catch up on both parts today:
Part 1:https://lnkd.in/gp8Af8GMPart 2:https://lnkd.in/gpSCRh5f 34,294 followers 🎙️ Part 2 of this week's#podcastwithFazzDeputy CEOTianwei Liu🚀 5#Regulationand#compliancelearnings from 10+ years pioneering#fintechsolutions out of#Singapore🇸🇬

InSingapore FinTech Festival2023, Fazz's digital asset infrastructure business StraitsX received in-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD stablecoins, opening up opportunities we covered in part 1:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9tPart 2 goes into learnings developing regulatory and compliance maturity from 7+ years pioneering fintech infrastructure solutions out of Singapore 

1️⃣ Continuous dialogue is key. 

🎙️ “...for compliance and fintech, talking to regulators, having an open dialogue, showing consistency and who's the person behind the company and what are you trying to achieve here...builds trust and credibility.”

2️⃣ A culture of customer-centric compliance is even more important to set the pace of product development, especially when developers are layers away from end-consumers. 

🎙️ “...“move fast and break things” does not apply here. In payments and fintech, you can't break things...You actually have to set the culture to do things right the first time and consider the impact on the customers and on people…”

3️⃣ Participate in regulatory sandboxes and make the most of regulatory openness to experimentation.

🎙️ “[They] allow you to basically do the smallest field experiments, to demonstrate certain things before getting to your bigger customers…”

4️⃣ Regulation opens doors to previously inaccessible market segments (e.g., FIs and banks) but the product makes the first step. 

🎙️ “Getting these licenses and compliance helps to give you a stamp of approval. It is not enough, but it's definitely more helpful to at least help education move along. It also means that institutions are able then to adopt this blockchain technology...you can then serve a wider customer that traditionally would either be fearful or unable to reach.”

5️⃣ Time and place matter when it comes to regulation. There are also regulatory blue oceans as well and this factors into the growth potential of the business. 

“Singapore is in a perfect position to do it, because of the regulation regime where you probably would think about China and other jurisdictions being geopolitically sensitive as well...potentially, this means for the whole entire region there will be a lot more adoption given that now Singapore has set the bar down.”

Tianwei Liu, CEO & Co-Founder of StraitsX, had this to say about our journey in unlocking blockchain-enabled payments when he recently sat down for the latest instalment of the 'On Call withInsignia Ventures Partners' podcast series: 

"It’s almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD transacted on-chain… It’s beyond our [expectations] initially how this has come along. A lot of us here are big believers.. and technology is at the heart of what we do. We’re trying to solve problems. And we see that blockchain solutions do have merit to address things that traditional centralised systems [otherwise] cannot do. And that’s why we have been very focused and interested in the [real-world] application of stablecoins."

Listen to Part 1 of the podcast below, and keep a look out for Part 2 soon! 34,294 followers 🎙️ New podcast episode 🚀 4 impacts ofStraitsXin-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of fiat-backed stablecoins XSGD and XUSD

This week’s episode has returning guestTianwei Liu, Deputy CEO of Southeast Asia#fintechgroupFazz, the company behind digital asset infrastructure providerStraitsX. 

In 2023’sSingapore FinTech Festival, StraitsX received in-principle approval by the MAS for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD, opening up opportunities we cover in this first half of our call with the seasoned fintech#entrepreneur. 

1️⃣ For Fazz: building on five years of pioneering blockchain transactions to unlock more inter-currency corridors

🎙️ “It's almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD has been transacted on-chain...it gives us the confidence that this is going to be a regulated industry...and beyond the Singapore dollars...we are now able to issue G10 currency stablecoins out of Singapore with this new license regime and XUSD, which is what we're gonna be focusing our effort on in the coming years.”

2️⃣ For Singapore and ASEAN: More mainstream adoption with increased credibility and trust from regulators and institutions

🎙️ “It brings about the credibility that using this kind of medium to facilitate innovation in payment is the way that regulators around the world should be looking at this...It allows service providers like us and other players to be able to confidently say that what we are doing is regulated and we are doing this according to the standards needed both on the AML control side, as well on custody and the way that we safeguard the user's funds.”

3️⃣ For merchants and end-consumers: The same transactions, but faster, cheaper, and more interoperable thanks to blockchain technology (we cover the case of StraitsX collaborating with Grabpay and Alipay)

🎙️ “We can make this purpose-bound money the most purposeful and compliant by design...So the ML and compliance risk can be ring-fenced and properly controlled. Settlement will be instantaneous. Then the FX ability of the blockchain...can happen at a microtransaction level.”

4️⃣ For payments industry: Moving forward momentum of innovation (that comes in stages)

🎙️ “First, increase the acceptance and make sure that it's as seamless as possible without drop off rate. Then you go into costs. Can I make sure my cost is as low as possible, especially for cross border...Then the innovation, which is free game for a lot of guys to come in.”

Today we share a timely story on the value of localizing frontier technologies like digital assets on a regulatory and compliance level

This isTianwei Liu, Group Deputy CEO ofFazz. (Photo taken from when we took our limited partners to visit the Singapore Fazz office for our Annual Summit)

Tianwei is an engineer who returned to Singapore from Silicon Valley, and in 2015 started a payments infrastructure company thanks in part to some cross-border Christmas gift experiences (he shares more in our podcast). Along the way, an initiative came about internally to develop Singapore’s first regulated stablecoin throughStraitsX. 

Fast forward to 2023, their work in maturing this stablecoin marked a new milestone in last week’sSingapore FinTech Festival.

In a speech (see link in the comments), theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)’s Managing Director Ravi Menon also announced that “MAS has granted in-principle approval under the Payment Services Act to three entities who will issue stable coins that substantively comply with MAS’ upcoming stablecoin regulatory framework…Once the legislative amendments take effect, these stable coins will be regarded as “MAS-regulated stablecoins”. These includeStraitsXSGD issuance that will house the XSGD pegged stablecoin already on the market, and StraitsX USD Issuance. 

This is a step forward in developing a truly sustainable digital currency. And through Project Orchid, well-regulated stable coins are already being trialled for use cases like purpose-bound money. For example, StraitsX enables XSGD-backed purpose-bound money to facilitate escrow arrangements in e-commerce transactions, ensuring that funds are released to merchants only when the customer receives the purchased items. It was also tested in the Festival, in partnership with Amazon and Grab.

This development comes full circle to what Tianwei shared on our podcast a year ago: 
“You’re going to have a world that is going to be nominated in US dollars, everything is US dollars-based, but day-to-day wise, do we ever see a US dollar and we will use it as the ultimate payment [method]? 

I don’t think that will ever happen. So we need to figure out how to make sure that there is a thriving decentralized finance ecosystem in the Asia Pacific. Be it Singaporean dollars, Indonesia rupiah, Philippine pesos or in Vietnamese dong, it has to be built out by the locals, and that will require us to be the pioneers. And actually working very closely with regulators to build out that ecosystem for ourselves.” 

Localization for startups is no longer just a matter of developing products for a specific market, but ensuring that the business is operationally compliant with local regulations. This presents an even greater competitive advantage for startups able to develop their compliance muscle. 

Kudos to Tianwei and the StraitsX team for this milestone!#digitalassets#sff2023#straitsx#fazz#IVPAnnualSummit2023

profile_bio:
StraitsX is the pioneering payments infrastructure for the digital assets space in Southeast Asia. It is a Major Payment Institution licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore. 

StraitsX offers personal and business accounts to transfer and hold funds as well as to connect accounts to digital asset platforms. Business accounts can also access B2B API-enabled payments rails for digital asset platforms. 

StraitsX issues the Singapore Dollar-backed stablecoin, XSGD & Indonesian Rupiah-backed stablecoin.

StraitsX is a brand under Fazz, backed and supported by prominent investors including Tiger Global, Insignia Venture Partners, B Capital, BRI Ventures.

For more information, please visit straitsx.com.

🎙ICYMI: Our CEO and Co-Founder,Tianwei Liusat down withInsignia Ventures Partnersfor a two-part podcast; sharing insights and personal learnings from developing regulatory and compliance maturity across seven years of pioneering#fintechinfrastructure solutions out of Singapore and more than ten years of#entrepreneurship.

🎧 Catch up on both parts today:
Part 1:https://lnkd.in/gp8Af8GMPart 2:https://lnkd.in/gpSCRh5f 34,318 followers 🎙️ Part 2 of this week's#podcastwithFazzDeputy CEOTianwei Liu🚀 5#Regulationand#compliancelearnings from 10+ years pioneering#fintechsolutions out of#Singapore🇸🇬

InSingapore FinTech Festival2023, Fazz's digital asset infrastructure business StraitsX received in-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD stablecoins, opening up opportunities we covered in part 1:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9tPart 2 goes into learnings developing regulatory and compliance maturity from 7+ years pioneering fintech infrastructure solutions out of Singapore 

1️⃣ Continuous dialogue is key. 

🎙️ “...for compliance and fintech, talking to regulators, having an open dialogue, showing consistency and who's the person behind the company and what are you trying to achieve here...builds trust and credibility.”

2️⃣ A culture of customer-centric compliance is even more important to set the pace of product development, especially when developers are layers away from end-consumers. 

🎙️ “...“move fast and break things” does not apply here. In payments and fintech, you can't break things...You actually have to set the culture to do things right the first time and consider the impact on the customers and on people…”

3️⃣ Participate in regulatory sandboxes and make the most of regulatory openness to experimentation.

🎙️ “[They] allow you to basically do the smallest field experiments, to demonstrate certain things before getting to your bigger customers…”

4️⃣ Regulation opens doors to previously inaccessible market segments (e.g., FIs and banks) but the product makes the first step. 

🎙️ “Getting these licenses and compliance helps to give you a stamp of approval. It is not enough, but it's definitely more helpful to at least help education move along. It also means that institutions are able then to adopt this blockchain technology...you can then serve a wider customer that traditionally would either be fearful or unable to reach.”

5️⃣ Time and place matter when it comes to regulation. There are also regulatory blue oceans as well and this factors into the growth potential of the business. 

“Singapore is in a perfect position to do it, because of the regulation regime where you probably would think about China and other jurisdictions being geopolitically sensitive as well...potentially, this means for the whole entire region there will be a lot more adoption given that now Singapore has set the bar down.”

Tianwei Liu, CEO & Co-Founder of StraitsX, had this to say about our journey in unlocking blockchain-enabled payments when he recently sat down for the latest instalment of the 'On Call withInsignia Ventures Partners' podcast series: 

"It’s almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD transacted on-chain… It’s beyond our [expectations] initially how this has come along. A lot of us here are big believers.. and technology is at the heart of what we do. We’re trying to solve problems. And we see that blockchain solutions do have merit to address things that traditional centralised systems [otherwise] cannot do. And that’s why we have been very focused and interested in the [real-world] application of stablecoins."

Listen to Part 1 of the podcast below, and keep a look out for Part 2 soon! 34,318 followers 🎙️ New podcast episode 🚀 4 impacts ofStraitsXin-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of fiat-backed stablecoins XSGD and XUSD

This week’s episode has returning guestTianwei Liu, Deputy CEO of Southeast Asia#fintechgroupFazz, the company behind digital asset infrastructure providerStraitsX. 

In 2023’sSingapore FinTech Festival, StraitsX received in-principle approval by the MAS for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD, opening up opportunities we cover in this first half of our call with the seasoned fintech#entrepreneur. 

1️⃣ For Fazz: building on five years of pioneering blockchain transactions to unlock more inter-currency corridors

🎙️ “It's almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD has been transacted on-chain...it gives us the confidence that this is going to be a regulated industry...and beyond the Singapore dollars...we are now able to issue G10 currency stablecoins out of Singapore with this new license regime and XUSD, which is what we're gonna be focusing our effort on in the coming years.”

2️⃣ For Singapore and ASEAN: More mainstream adoption with increased credibility and trust from regulators and institutions

🎙️ “It brings about the credibility that using this kind of medium to facilitate innovation in payment is the way that regulators around the world should be looking at this...It allows service providers like us and other players to be able to confidently say that what we are doing is regulated and we are doing this according to the standards needed both on the AML control side, as well on custody and the way that we safeguard the user's funds.”

3️⃣ For merchants and end-consumers: The same transactions, but faster, cheaper, and more interoperable thanks to blockchain technology (we cover the case of StraitsX collaborating with Grabpay and Alipay)

🎙️ “We can make this purpose-bound money the most purposeful and compliant by design...So the ML and compliance risk can be ring-fenced and properly controlled. Settlement will be instantaneous. Then the FX ability of the blockchain...can happen at a microtransaction level.”

4️⃣ For payments industry: Moving forward momentum of innovation (that comes in stages)

🎙️ “First, increase the acceptance and make sure that it's as seamless as possible without drop off rate. Then you go into costs. Can I make sure my cost is as low as possible, especially for cross border...Then the innovation, which is free game for a lot of guys to come in.”

👉 See the rest of the insights and the full podcast on Insignia Business Review:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9t👀 Or watch it on
Spotify:https://lnkd.in/gVbMjfSCApple Podcasts:https://lnkd.in/gyiryNiXYouTube:youtu.be/y-kEDB-ge_A📸 Photo from StraitsX

Today we share a timely story on the value of localizing frontier technologies like digital assets on a regulatory and compliance level

This isTianwei Liu, Group Deputy CEO ofFazz. (Photo taken from when we took our limited partners to visit the Singapore Fazz office for our Annual Summit)

Tianwei is an engineer who returned to Singapore from Silicon Valley, and in 2015 started a payments infrastructure company thanks in part to some cross-border Christmas gift experiences (he shares more in our podcast). Along the way, an initiative came about internally to develop Singapore’s first regulated stablecoin throughStraitsX. 

Fast forward to 2023, their work in maturing this stablecoin marked a new milestone in last week’sSingapore FinTech Festival.

In a speech (see link in the comments), theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)’s Managing Director Ravi Menon also announced that “MAS has granted in-principle approval under the Payment Services Act to three entities who will issue stable coins that substantively comply with MAS’ upcoming stablecoin regulatory framework…Once the legislative amendments take effect, these stable coins will be regarded as “MAS-regulated stablecoins”. These includeStraitsXSGD issuance that will house the XSGD pegged stablecoin already on the market, and StraitsX USD Issuance. 

This is a step forward in developing a truly sustainable digital currency. And through Project Orchid, well-regulated stable coins are already being trialled for use cases like purpose-bound money. For example, StraitsX enables XSGD-backed purpose-bound money to facilitate escrow arrangements in e-commerce transactions, ensuring that funds are released to merchants only when the customer receives the purchased items. It was also tested in the Festival, in partnership with Amazon and Grab.

This development comes full circle to what Tianwei shared on our podcast a year ago: 
“You’re going to have a world that is going to be nominated in US dollars, everything is US dollars-based, but day-to-day wise, do we ever see a US dollar and we will use it as the ultimate payment [method]? 

I don’t think that will ever happen. So we need to figure out how to make sure that there is a thriving decentralized finance ecosystem in the Asia Pacific. Be it Singaporean dollars, Indonesia rupiah, Philippine pesos or in Vietnamese dong, it has to be built out by the locals, and that will require us to be the pioneers. And actually working very closely with regulators to build out that ecosystem for ourselves.” 

Localization for startups is no longer just a matter of developing products for a specific market, but ensuring that the business is operationally compliant with local regulations. This presents an even greater competitive advantage for startups able to develop their compliance muscle. 

Kudos to Tianwei and the StraitsX team for this milestone!#digitalassets#sff2023#straitsx#fazz#IVPAnnualSummit2023

profile_bio:
StraitsX is the pioneering payments infrastructure for the digital assets space in Southeast Asia. It is a Major Payment Institution licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore. 

StraitsX offers personal and business accounts to transfer and hold funds as well as to connect accounts to digital asset platforms. Business accounts can also access B2B API-enabled payments rails for digital asset platforms. 

StraitsX issues the Singapore Dollar-backed stablecoin, XSGD & Indonesian Rupiah-backed stablecoin.

StraitsX is a brand under Fazz, backed and supported by prominent investors including Tiger Global, Insignia Venture Partners, B Capital, BRI Ventures.

For more information, please visit straitsx.com.

🌟 Exciting insights from this morning's roundtable discussion on "Digital Money in Action" atJapan FinTech Festival! 💼💡

Together with other esteemed industry leaders, our CEO and Co-founder,Tianwei Liuexplored how#stablecoinsand#blockchaintechnology are revolutionising cross-border payments, enhancing efficiency, reducing costs, with concepts of programmability and interoperability at the core of a more robust payments and financial system.

Some key discussion points include:

3. The significance of interoperability to minimise "walled gardens" and promote seamless connectivity across platforms 🌐🤝

🎙ICYMI: Our CEO and Co-Founder,Tianwei Liusat down withInsignia Ventures Partnersfor a two-part podcast; sharing insights and personal learnings from developing regulatory and compliance maturity across seven years of pioneering#fintechinfrastructure solutions out of Singapore and more than ten years of#entrepreneurship.

🎧 Catch up on both parts today:
Part 1:https://lnkd.in/gp8Af8GMPart 2:https://lnkd.in/gpSCRh5f 34,339 followers 🎙️ Part 2 of this week's#podcastwithFazzDeputy CEOTianwei Liu🚀 5#Regulationand#compliancelearnings from 10+ years pioneering#fintechsolutions out of#Singapore🇸🇬

InSingapore FinTech Festival2023, Fazz's digital asset infrastructure business StraitsX received in-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD stablecoins, opening up opportunities we covered in part 1:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9tPart 2 goes into learnings developing regulatory and compliance maturity from 7+ years pioneering fintech infrastructure solutions out of Singapore 

1️⃣ Continuous dialogue is key. 

🎙️ “...for compliance and fintech, talking to regulators, having an open dialogue, showing consistency and who's the person behind the company and what are you trying to achieve here...builds trust and credibility.”

2️⃣ A culture of customer-centric compliance is even more important to set the pace of product development, especially when developers are layers away from end-consumers. 

🎙️ “...“move fast and break things” does not apply here. In payments and fintech, you can't break things...You actually have to set the culture to do things right the first time and consider the impact on the customers and on people…”

3️⃣ Participate in regulatory sandboxes and make the most of regulatory openness to experimentation.

🎙️ “[They] allow you to basically do the smallest field experiments, to demonstrate certain things before getting to your bigger customers…”

4️⃣ Regulation opens doors to previously inaccessible market segments (e.g., FIs and banks) but the product makes the first step. 

🎙️ “Getting these licenses and compliance helps to give you a stamp of approval. It is not enough, but it's definitely more helpful to at least help education move along. It also means that institutions are able then to adopt this blockchain technology...you can then serve a wider customer that traditionally would either be fearful or unable to reach.”

5️⃣ Time and place matter when it comes to regulation. There are also regulatory blue oceans as well and this factors into the growth potential of the business. 

“Singapore is in a perfect position to do it, because of the regulation regime where you probably would think about China and other jurisdictions being geopolitically sensitive as well...potentially, this means for the whole entire region there will be a lot more adoption given that now Singapore has set the bar down.”

👉 See the rest of the insights:https://lnkd.in/gKcWyCYV👀 Or watch it on
Spotify:https://lnkd.in/g6D3_Z5vApple Podcasts:https://lnkd.in/gg36bWHNYouTube:https://lnkd.in/gKZ2aXRT

Tianwei Liu, CEO & Co-Founder of StraitsX, had this to say about our journey in unlocking blockchain-enabled payments when he recently sat down for the latest instalment of the 'On Call withInsignia Ventures Partners' podcast series: 

"It’s almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD transacted on-chain… It’s beyond our [expectations] initially how this has come along. A lot of us here are big believers.. and technology is at the heart of what we do. We’re trying to solve problems. And we see that blockchain solutions do have merit to address things that traditional centralised systems [otherwise] cannot do. And that’s why we have been very focused and interested in the [real-world] application of stablecoins."

Listen to Part 1 of the podcast below, and keep a look out for Part 2 soon! 34,339 followers 🎙️ New podcast episode 🚀 4 impacts ofStraitsXin-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of fiat-backed stablecoins XSGD and XUSD

This week’s episode has returning guestTianwei Liu, Deputy CEO of Southeast Asia#fintechgroupFazz, the company behind digital asset infrastructure providerStraitsX. 

In 2023’sSingapore FinTech Festival, StraitsX received in-principle approval by the MAS for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD, opening up opportunities we cover in this first half of our call with the seasoned fintech#entrepreneur. 

1️⃣ For Fazz: building on five years of pioneering blockchain transactions to unlock more inter-currency corridors

🎙️ “It's almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD has been transacted on-chain...it gives us the confidence that this is going to be a regulated industry...and beyond the Singapore dollars...we are now able to issue G10 currency stablecoins out of Singapore with this new license regime and XUSD, which is what we're gonna be focusing our effort on in the coming years.”

2️⃣ For Singapore and ASEAN: More mainstream adoption with increased credibility and trust from regulators and institutions

🎙️ “It brings about the credibility that using this kind of medium to facilitate innovation in payment is the way that regulators around the world should be looking at this...It allows service providers like us and other players to be able to confidently say that what we are doing is regulated and we are doing this according to the standards needed both on the AML control side, as well on custody and the way that we safeguard the user's funds.”

3️⃣ For merchants and end-consumers: The same transactions, but faster, cheaper, and more interoperable thanks to blockchain technology (we cover the case of StraitsX collaborating with Grabpay and Alipay)

🎙️ “We can make this purpose-bound money the most purposeful and compliant by design...So the ML and compliance risk can be ring-fenced and properly controlled. Settlement will be instantaneous. Then the FX ability of the blockchain...can happen at a microtransaction level.”

4️⃣ For payments industry: Moving forward momentum of innovation (that comes in stages)

🎙️ “First, increase the acceptance and make sure that it's as seamless as possible without drop off rate. Then you go into costs. Can I make sure my cost is as low as possible, especially for cross border...Then the innovation, which is free game for a lot of guys to come in.”

👉 See the rest of the insights and the full podcast on Insignia Business Review:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9t👀 Or watch it on

Today we share a timely story on the value of localizing frontier technologies like digital assets on a regulatory and compliance level

This isTianwei Liu, Group Deputy CEO ofFazz. (Photo taken from when we took our limited partners to visit the Singapore Fazz office for our Annual Summit)

Tianwei is an engineer who returned to Singapore from Silicon Valley, and in 2015 started a payments infrastructure company thanks in part to some cross-border Christmas gift experiences (he shares more in our podcast). Along the way, an initiative came about internally to develop Singapore’s first regulated stablecoin throughStraitsX. 

Fast forward to 2023, their work in maturing this stablecoin marked a new milestone in last week’sSingapore FinTech Festival.

In a speech (see link in the comments), theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)’s Managing Director Ravi Menon also announced that “MAS has granted in-principle approval under the Payment Services Act to three entities who will issue stable coins that substantively comply with MAS’ upcoming stablecoin regulatory framework…Once the legislative amendments take effect, these stable coins will be regarded as “MAS-regulated stablecoins”. These includeStraitsXSGD issuance that will house the XSGD pegged stablecoin already on the market, and StraitsX USD Issuance. 

This is a step forward in developing a truly sustainable digital currency. And through Project Orchid, well-regulated stable coins are already being trialled for use cases like purpose-bound money. For example, StraitsX enables XSGD-backed purpose-bound money to facilitate escrow arrangements in e-commerce transactions, ensuring that funds are released to merchants only when the customer receives the purchased items. It was also tested in the Festival, in partnership with Amazon and Grab.

This development comes full circle to what Tianwei shared on our podcast a year ago: 
“You’re going to have a world that is going to be nominated in US dollars, everything is US dollars-based, but day-to-day wise, do we ever see a US dollar and we will use it as the ultimate payment [method]? 

I don’t think that will ever happen. So we need to figure out how to make sure that there is a thriving decentralized finance ecosystem in the Asia Pacific. Be it Singaporean dollars, Indonesia rupiah, Philippine pesos or in Vietnamese dong, it has to be built out by the locals, and that will require us to be the pioneers. And actually working very closely with regulators to build out that ecosystem for ourselves.” 

Localization for startups is no longer just a matter of developing products for a specific market, but ensuring that the business is operationally compliant with local regulations. This presents an even greater competitive advantage for startups able to develop their compliance muscle. 

Kudos to Tianwei and the StraitsX team for this milestone!#digitalassets#sff2023#straitsx#fazz#IVPAnnualSummit2023

profile_bio:
StraitsX is the pioneering payments infrastructure for the digital assets space in Southeast Asia. It is a Major Payment Institution licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore. 

StraitsX offers personal and business accounts to transfer and hold funds as well as to connect accounts to digital asset platforms. Business accounts can also access B2B API-enabled payments rails for digital asset platforms. 

StraitsX issues the Singapore Dollar-backed stablecoin, XSGD & Indonesian Rupiah-backed stablecoin.

StraitsX is a brand under Fazz, backed and supported by prominent investors including Tiger Global, Insignia Venture Partners, B Capital, BRI Ventures.

For more information, please visit straitsx.com.

🎙ICYMI: Our CEO and Co-Founder,Tianwei Liusat down withInsignia Ventures Partnersfor a two-part podcast; sharing insights and personal learnings from developing regulatory and compliance maturity across seven years of pioneering#fintechinfrastructure solutions out of Singapore and more than ten years of#entrepreneurship.

🎧 Catch up on both parts today:
Part 1:https://lnkd.in/gp8Af8GMPart 2:https://lnkd.in/gpSCRh5f 34,363 followers 🎙️ Part 2 of this week's#podcastwithFazzDeputy CEOTianwei Liu🚀 5#Regulationand#compliancelearnings from 10+ years pioneering#fintechsolutions out of#Singapore🇸🇬

InSingapore FinTech Festival2023, Fazz's digital asset infrastructure business StraitsX received in-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD stablecoins, opening up opportunities we covered in part 1:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9tPart 2 goes into learnings developing regulatory and compliance maturity from 7+ years pioneering fintech infrastructure solutions out of Singapore 

1️⃣ Continuous dialogue is key. 

🎙️ “...for compliance and fintech, talking to regulators, having an open dialogue, showing consistency and who's the person behind the company and what are you trying to achieve here...builds trust and credibility.”

2️⃣ A culture of customer-centric compliance is even more important to set the pace of product development, especially when developers are layers away from end-consumers. 

🎙️ “...“move fast and break things” does not apply here. In payments and fintech, you can't break things...You actually have to set the culture to do things right the first time and consider the impact on the customers and on people…”

3️⃣ Participate in regulatory sandboxes and make the most of regulatory openness to experimentation.

🎙️ “[They] allow you to basically do the smallest field experiments, to demonstrate certain things before getting to your bigger customers…”

4️⃣ Regulation opens doors to previously inaccessible market segments (e.g., FIs and banks) but the product makes the first step. 

🎙️ “Getting these licenses and compliance helps to give you a stamp of approval. It is not enough, but it's definitely more helpful to at least help education move along. It also means that institutions are able then to adopt this blockchain technology...you can then serve a wider customer that traditionally would either be fearful or unable to reach.”

5️⃣ Time and place matter when it comes to regulation. There are also regulatory blue oceans as well and this factors into the growth potential of the business. 

“Singapore is in a perfect position to do it, because of the regulation regime where you probably would think about China and other jurisdictions being geopolitically sensitive as well...potentially, this means for the whole entire region there will be a lot more adoption given that now Singapore has set the bar down.”

Tianwei Liu, CEO & Co-Founder of StraitsX, had this to say about our journey in unlocking blockchain-enabled payments when he recently sat down for the latest instalment of the 'On Call withInsignia Ventures Partners' podcast series: 

"It’s almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD transacted on-chain… It’s beyond our [expectations] initially how this has come along. A lot of us here are big believers.. and technology is at the heart of what we do. We’re trying to solve problems. And we see that blockchain solutions do have merit to address things that traditional centralised systems [otherwise] cannot do. And that’s why we have been very focused and interested in the [real-world] application of stablecoins."

Listen to Part 1 of the podcast below, and keep a look out for Part 2 soon! 34,363 followers 🎙️ New podcast episode 🚀 4 impacts ofStraitsXin-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of fiat-backed stablecoins XSGD and XUSD

This week’s episode has returning guestTianwei Liu, Deputy CEO of Southeast Asia#fintechgroupFazz, the company behind digital asset infrastructure providerStraitsX. 

In 2023’sSingapore FinTech Festival, StraitsX received in-principle approval by the MAS for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD, opening up opportunities we cover in this first half of our call with the seasoned fintech#entrepreneur. 

1️⃣ For Fazz: building on five years of pioneering blockchain transactions to unlock more inter-currency corridors

🎙️ “It's almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD has been transacted on-chain...it gives us the confidence that this is going to be a regulated industry...and beyond the Singapore dollars...we are now able to issue G10 currency stablecoins out of Singapore with this new license regime and XUSD, which is what we're gonna be focusing our effort on in the coming years.”

2️⃣ For Singapore and ASEAN: More mainstream adoption with increased credibility and trust from regulators and institutions

🎙️ “It brings about the credibility that using this kind of medium to facilitate innovation in payment is the way that regulators around the world should be looking at this...It allows service providers like us and other players to be able to confidently say that what we are doing is regulated and we are doing this according to the standards needed both on the AML control side, as well on custody and the way that we safeguard the user's funds.”

3️⃣ For merchants and end-consumers: The same transactions, but faster, cheaper, and more interoperable thanks to blockchain technology (we cover the case of StraitsX collaborating with Grabpay and Alipay)

🎙️ “We can make this purpose-bound money the most purposeful and compliant by design...So the ML and compliance risk can be ring-fenced and properly controlled. Settlement will be instantaneous. Then the FX ability of the blockchain...can happen at a microtransaction level.”

4️⃣ For payments industry: Moving forward momentum of innovation (that comes in stages)

🎙️ “First, increase the acceptance and make sure that it's as seamless as possible without drop off rate. Then you go into costs. Can I make sure my cost is as low as possible, especially for cross border...Then the innovation, which is free game for a lot of guys to come in.”

Today we share a timely story on the value of localizing frontier technologies like digital assets on a regulatory and compliance level

This isTianwei Liu, Group Deputy CEO ofFazz. (Photo taken from when we took our limited partners to visit the Singapore Fazz office for our Annual Summit)

Tianwei is an engineer who returned to Singapore from Silicon Valley, and in 2015 started a payments infrastructure company thanks in part to some cross-border Christmas gift experiences (he shares more in our podcast). Along the way, an initiative came about internally to develop Singapore’s first regulated stablecoin throughStraitsX. 

Fast forward to 2023, their work in maturing this stablecoin marked a new milestone in last week’sSingapore FinTech Festival.

In a speech (see link in the comments), theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)’s Managing Director Ravi Menon also announced that “MAS has granted in-principle approval under the Payment Services Act to three entities who will issue stable coins that substantively comply with MAS’ upcoming stablecoin regulatory framework…Once the legislative amendments take effect, these stable coins will be regarded as “MAS-regulated stablecoins”. These includeStraitsXSGD issuance that will house the XSGD pegged stablecoin already on the market, and StraitsX USD Issuance. 

This is a step forward in developing a truly sustainable digital currency. And through Project Orchid, well-regulated stable coins are already being trialled for use cases like purpose-bound money. For example, StraitsX enables XSGD-backed purpose-bound money to facilitate escrow arrangements in e-commerce transactions, ensuring that funds are released to merchants only when the customer receives the purchased items. It was also tested in the Festival, in partnership with Amazon and Grab.

This development comes full circle to what Tianwei shared on our podcast a year ago: 
“You’re going to have a world that is going to be nominated in US dollars, everything is US dollars-based, but day-to-day wise, do we ever see a US dollar and we will use it as the ultimate payment [method]? 

I don’t think that will ever happen. So we need to figure out how to make sure that there is a thriving decentralized finance ecosystem in the Asia Pacific. Be it Singaporean dollars, Indonesia rupiah, Philippine pesos or in Vietnamese dong, it has to be built out by the locals, and that will require us to be the pioneers. And actually working very closely with regulators to build out that ecosystem for ourselves.” 

Localization for startups is no longer just a matter of developing products for a specific market, but ensuring that the business is operationally compliant with local regulations. This presents an even greater competitive advantage for startups able to develop their compliance muscle. 

Kudos to Tianwei and the StraitsX team for this milestone!#digitalassets#sff2023#straitsx#fazz#IVPAnnualSummit2023

In case you've missed it - We shared our thoughts withThe Straits Timeson upcoming plans with regards to MAS's newly proposed framework for Singapore-based#stablecoinissuers. Watch this space for more updates on our#XSGDjourney 👉StraitsX.com Crypto | Payments & Stablecoin | General Management and Strategy Executive With MAS's newly proposed framework for stablecoin issuers,StraitsXis supportive of the requirements that asset-backed#stablecoinissuers must follow (e.g. reserve-asset requirements, prudential requirements, liquidity requirements).

This provides clarity for us to work towards early compliance with the finalised framework, and will eventually help users better differentiate a fully-backed#XSGDfrom other digital assets out there. 

With greater consumer clarity and confidence that all MAS-regulated SCS will share the same characteristics and features, this also further supports our development of additional value-added payment use cases.

profile_bio:
StraitsX is the pioneering payments infrastructure for the digital assets space in Southeast Asia. It is a Major Payment Institution licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore. 

StraitsX offers personal and business accounts to transfer and hold funds as well as to connect accounts to digital asset platforms. Business accounts can also access B2B API-enabled payments rails for digital asset platforms. 

StraitsX issues the Singapore Dollar-backed stablecoin, XSGD & Indonesian Rupiah-backed stablecoin.

StraitsX is a brand under Fazz, backed and supported by prominent investors including Tiger Global, Insignia Venture Partners, B Capital, BRI Ventures.

For more information, please visit straitsx.com.

🎙ICYMI: Our CEO and Co-Founder,Tianwei Liusat down withInsignia Ventures Partnersfor a two-part podcast; sharing insights and personal learnings from developing regulatory and compliance maturity across seven years of pioneering#fintechinfrastructure solutions out of Singapore and more than ten years of#entrepreneurship.

🎧 Catch up on both parts today:
Part 1:https://lnkd.in/gp8Af8GMPart 2:https://lnkd.in/gpSCRh5f 34,390 followers 🎙️ Part 2 of this week's#podcastwithFazzDeputy CEOTianwei Liu🚀 5#Regulationand#compliancelearnings from 10+ years pioneering#fintechsolutions out of#Singapore🇸🇬

InSingapore FinTech Festival2023, Fazz's digital asset infrastructure business StraitsX received in-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD stablecoins, opening up opportunities we covered in part 1:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9tPart 2 goes into learnings developing regulatory and compliance maturity from 7+ years pioneering fintech infrastructure solutions out of Singapore 

1️⃣ Continuous dialogue is key. 

🎙️ “...for compliance and fintech, talking to regulators, having an open dialogue, showing consistency and who's the person behind the company and what are you trying to achieve here...builds trust and credibility.”

2️⃣ A culture of customer-centric compliance is even more important to set the pace of product development, especially when developers are layers away from end-consumers. 

🎙️ “...“move fast and break things” does not apply here. In payments and fintech, you can't break things...You actually have to set the culture to do things right the first time and consider the impact on the customers and on people…”

3️⃣ Participate in regulatory sandboxes and make the most of regulatory openness to experimentation.

🎙️ “[They] allow you to basically do the smallest field experiments, to demonstrate certain things before getting to your bigger customers…”

4️⃣ Regulation opens doors to previously inaccessible market segments (e.g., FIs and banks) but the product makes the first step. 

🎙️ “Getting these licenses and compliance helps to give you a stamp of approval. It is not enough, but it's definitely more helpful to at least help education move along. It also means that institutions are able then to adopt this blockchain technology...you can then serve a wider customer that traditionally would either be fearful or unable to reach.”

5️⃣ Time and place matter when it comes to regulation. There are also regulatory blue oceans as well and this factors into the growth potential of the business. 

“Singapore is in a perfect position to do it, because of the regulation regime where you probably would think about China and other jurisdictions being geopolitically sensitive as well...potentially, this means for the whole entire region there will be a lot more adoption given that now Singapore has set the bar down.”

Tianwei Liu, CEO & Co-Founder of StraitsX, had this to say about our journey in unlocking blockchain-enabled payments when he recently sat down for the latest instalment of the 'On Call withInsignia Ventures Partners' podcast series: 

"It’s almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD transacted on-chain… It’s beyond our [expectations] initially how this has come along. A lot of us here are big believers.. and technology is at the heart of what we do. We’re trying to solve problems. And we see that blockchain solutions do have merit to address things that traditional centralised systems [otherwise] cannot do. And that’s why we have been very focused and interested in the [real-world] application of stablecoins."

Listen to Part 1 of the podcast below, and keep a look out for Part 2 soon! 34,390 followers 🎙️ New podcast episode 🚀 4 impacts ofStraitsXin-principle approval by theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)for the issuance of fiat-backed stablecoins XSGD and XUSD

This week’s episode has returning guestTianwei Liu, Deputy CEO of Southeast Asia#fintechgroupFazz, the company behind digital asset infrastructure providerStraitsX. 

In 2023’sSingapore FinTech Festival, StraitsX received in-principle approval by the MAS for the issuance of XSGD and XUSD, opening up opportunities we cover in this first half of our call with the seasoned fintech#entrepreneur. 

1️⃣ For Fazz: building on five years of pioneering blockchain transactions to unlock more inter-currency corridors

🎙️ “It's almost four or five years since we launched XSGD, and close to 8 billion XSGD has been transacted on-chain...it gives us the confidence that this is going to be a regulated industry...and beyond the Singapore dollars...we are now able to issue G10 currency stablecoins out of Singapore with this new license regime and XUSD, which is what we're gonna be focusing our effort on in the coming years.”

2️⃣ For Singapore and ASEAN: More mainstream adoption with increased credibility and trust from regulators and institutions

🎙️ “It brings about the credibility that using this kind of medium to facilitate innovation in payment is the way that regulators around the world should be looking at this...It allows service providers like us and other players to be able to confidently say that what we are doing is regulated and we are doing this according to the standards needed both on the AML control side, as well on custody and the way that we safeguard the user's funds.”

3️⃣ For merchants and end-consumers: The same transactions, but faster, cheaper, and more interoperable thanks to blockchain technology (we cover the case of StraitsX collaborating with Grabpay and Alipay)

🎙️ “We can make this purpose-bound money the most purposeful and compliant by design...So the ML and compliance risk can be ring-fenced and properly controlled. Settlement will be instantaneous. Then the FX ability of the blockchain...can happen at a microtransaction level.”

4️⃣ For payments industry: Moving forward momentum of innovation (that comes in stages)

🎙️ “First, increase the acceptance and make sure that it's as seamless as possible without drop off rate. Then you go into costs. Can I make sure my cost is as low as possible, especially for cross border...Then the innovation, which is free game for a lot of guys to come in.”

👉 See the rest of the insights and the full podcast on Insignia Business Review:https://lnkd.in/g5ZTtF9t👀 Or watch it on

Today we share a timely story on the value of localizing frontier technologies like digital assets on a regulatory and compliance level

This isTianwei Liu, Group Deputy CEO ofFazz. (Photo taken from when we took our limited partners to visit the Singapore Fazz office for our Annual Summit)

Tianwei is an engineer who returned to Singapore from Silicon Valley, and in 2015 started a payments infrastructure company thanks in part to some cross-border Christmas gift experiences (he shares more in our podcast). Along the way, an initiative came about internally to develop Singapore’s first regulated stablecoin throughStraitsX. 

Fast forward to 2023, their work in maturing this stablecoin marked a new milestone in last week’sSingapore FinTech Festival.

In a speech (see link in the comments), theMonetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)’s Managing Director Ravi Menon also announced that “MAS has granted in-principle approval under the Payment Services Act to three entities who will issue stable coins that substantively comply with MAS’ upcoming stablecoin regulatory framework…Once the legislative amendments take effect, these stable coins will be regarded as “MAS-regulated stablecoins”. These includeStraitsXSGD issuance that will house the XSGD pegged stablecoin already on the market, and StraitsX USD Issuance. 

This is a step forward in developing a truly sustainable digital currency. And through Project Orchid, well-regulated stable coins are already being trialled for use cases like purpose-bound money. For example, StraitsX enables XSGD-backed purpose-bound money to facilitate escrow arrangements in e-commerce transactions, ensuring that funds are released to merchants only when the customer receives the purchased items. It was also tested in the Festival, in partnership with Amazon and Grab.

This development comes full circle to what Tianwei shared on our podcast a year ago: 
“You’re going to have a world that is going to be nominated in US dollars, everything is US dollars-based, but day-to-day wise, do we ever see a US dollar and we will use it as the ultimate payment [method]? 

I don’t think that will ever happen. So we need to figure out how to make sure that there is a thriving decentralized finance ecosystem in the Asia Pacific. Be it Singaporean dollars, Indonesia rupiah, Philippine pesos or in Vietnamese dong, it has to be built out by the locals, and that will require us to be the pioneers. And actually working very closely with regulators to build out that ecosystem for ourselves.” 

Localization for startups is no longer just a matter of developing products for a specific market, but ensuring that the business is operationally compliant with local regulations. This presents an even greater competitive advantage for startups able to develop their compliance muscle. 

Kudos to Tianwei and the StraitsX team for this milestone!#digitalassets#sff2023#straitsx#fazz#IVPAnnualSummit2023

prompts_output.Output:
1. Regulation: Discusses the importance of licenses and compliance for market access and institutional adoption.
2. User Experience: Focuses on inclusive, intuitive product design for seamless payment experiences.
3. Interoperability: Highlights the need to minimize "walled gardens" for seamless platform connectivity.
4. Technological Advancements: Explores stablecoins and blockchain in cross-border payments, emphasizing programmability and interoperability.

prompts_output.Prompt: Assess these posts for insights into investor behavior, concerns, and expectations regarding cryptocurrencies. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: Investors are concerned about challenges from events like Bitcoin halving but remain optimistic, expecting bolstered confidence and new strategies. They value inclusive, intuitive designs and interoperability to enhance seamless experiences and connectivity in the cryptocurrency space.

prompts_output.Prompt: Spot any emerging trends in topics discussed in these posts about the company. Are there any new developments, controversies, or milestones that are garnering attention? Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: Emerging trends include a focus on regulatory compliance, innovation in payments, and leveraging regulatory sandboxes for experimentation. No controversies are noted, but milestones include insights from CEO Tianwei Liu on fintech infrastructure and the company's proactive approach to regulatory and compliance maturity.

prompts_output.Prompt: Identify any patterns or strategies in these posts that resemble known cryptocurrency manipulation tactics such as pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts focus on technological advancements and partnerships, not on rapid price increases or guaranteed returns. They lack hallmarks of manipulation tactics like pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes, which typically involve hype, urgency, and promises of high returns.

prompts_output.Prompt: Analyze these posts to determine if any show characteristics of being generated by bots or automated accounts. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts do not show clear characteristics of being generated by bots or automated accounts. They include specific links, detailed information, and contextually relevant content, which suggests human authorship.

prompts_output.Prompt: Examine these posts for the presence of invite links to cryptocurrency channels or groups, and assess their potential role in manipulation schemes. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The post contains an invite link to a registration page for an event, not a cryptocurrency channel or group. There is no clear indication of manipulation schemes; the link appears to be for an informative session on stablecoins and Bitcoin halving.

prompts_output.Prompt: Categorize these posts based on their content and topics, focusing on how they relate to cryptocurrency market trends and investor behavior. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output:
1. Cryptocurrency market trends: Discusses the Bitcoin halving event and its potential impacts on miners, investors, and service providers.
2. Investor behavior: Highlights the importance of inclusive product design, interoperability, and seamless payment experiences to boost user adoption and confidence.
3. Cryptocurrency market trends: Ravi Menon's address on stablecoins as a contender for digital money.

overall_prompt_summary:
The outputs emphasize the significance of regulatory compliance, user experience, and technological advancements in the cryptocurrency and fintech sectors. They highlight the importance of inclusive product design, interoperability, and seamless payment experiences for user adoption and confidence.

Key issues include the need for licenses and compliance for market access, and the role of stablecoins and blockchain in cross-border payments. The posts do not exhibit characteristics of market manipulation or automated generation, indicating human authorship.

A potential improvement could be a deeper exploration of emerging trends and milestones to provide a more comprehensive understanding of the industry's direction.
